text: If you're originally from Vegas, you might like it but if you come from a city where a large Vietnamese resides. This pho isn't good. Too much sodium in the soup. Really nothing about this place besides it being open late.
Horrible service.  Very disorganized and dirty.  We ordered pho and it took 35 minutes to bring the food.
If I could give them 0 stars I would. Service was awful, the pho soup wasn't even hot. Flavoring was plain. Don't waste your time or money here!
The service is bad. I waited for 45 minutes with my family, and they forgot to place my order.
Best pho tai and egg rolls in Las Vegas. Service is decent but food is excellent, and that's all that matters.

Walking into the restaurant, my mom and I exchange a few words. "Gee, it's dirty". But a little grime never scared us off before. In fact, it's often joked that it's a good thing. The rest of our relatives are already there awaiting us, and so we quickly order our food, which arrives quickly via Hispanic servers who can say "Pho Tai" better than Hubby can.

My Pho' Tai Sach (rare steak with tripe pho') is average. What can I say, it's Vegas. The broth is a bit on the oily side but had a good flavor, and the noodles and meat are alright. My hubby liked his Pho' Dac Biet. 

My aunt suggested we order their Pho' Xao Thap Cam, which basically translates to "assorted fried pho'". This was a very interesting dish. The pho' noodles are fried to create a crunchy, chewy pancake layer on which an assortment of seafood, meats, and vegetables are placed on, and the whole thing is topped off with a sweet gravy reminiscent of Thai rad nah gravy. It wasn't out of this world, but it was pretty good. 

My cousin's verdict on his Bun Bo Hue (Hue beef noodle soup): good. 

I didn't think the Che Suong Sa Hot Luu (a Vietnamese dessert of agar and tapioca in coconut milk) was very good, as it was sparse on pretty much everything, but Hubby liked his Ca Phe Sua Da (Vietnamese Iced Coffee), which I noticed came out already in the glass.

Pho' So 1 means "Pho' Number 1", but I'd have to disagree when I think of all the pho' restaurants I've eaten at in SoCal. But because the food and prices are ok, this restaurant will be my go to Vietnamese restaurant for now in Vegas until we try out a few other ones there in the city. 

Lots of photos and full review on my blog.

My husband and I come here when we want our Pho fix... The prices are reasonable and the wait staff are very helpful. The atmosphere is casual and the place is clean. Most important tho.... The food is delicious!!
When it comes to Pho in Vegas...look no further. You will not find any better Pho even on the strip.

Came at 10:15 PM, my wife ordered a chicken and rice dish and I ordered a soup. Her food came in 5 minutes and I waited for the next 30 minutes thinking that it will come the next minute. Finally went up to the counter where they have the debit machine and found out they forgot it. Never got an apology from neither the waiter nor the person who billed me and adding insult to injury, they had an "eat our crap and get lost" attitude.
Huge portions , service is great, overall perfect place to eat when you're hung over in Vegas

Pho So 1 is located in Las Vegas' Chinatown district where there is gang load of Pho, Korean BBQ, and Japanese joints.  How did we pick this one?  We didn't really, it was based on a recommendation.  Recommendations are always good.

It's not the cleanest Pho joint but it's good enough.  Service is pretty friendly and fast so no complaints there.  The pho is a little less than 7 bucks and they only offer one size (about the size of a small/medium when compared to the ones in SF).  The rare steak and flank pho was good.  The broth was flavorful and had a good amount of noodles.  The meat was fattier than my liking but it was fine. 

It's nice to get away from the hustle and bustle of the strip and try something else besides the food that is offered on the strip.  The cab ride cost a little over $20 round trip but was worth it.  The strip food good can get boring after a while.

I typically order #10 whenever I go here for their special combo pho. First time I had this, I was amazed by the amount of meat they put in here. The broth-noodle proportion was just right on the spot with the extra meat, you can never go wrong. (:

I do love the fact that they are open until 3:00 am every night!

Pho so 1 use to be my favorite place for vietnamese food, I remember coming here every week for years and years. I have to admit the food here still taste great but the service is aweful. They have a sign that says" please wait to be seated" so i would stand next to the sign for like 10 freaken mins while everyone and there mom would just cut me lolz DU MA! Anywayse once you are seated, it takes another 10 mins for them to come get your order lolz.  I understand that sometimes its BUSY, but not freaken every time haha. Anywayse the food here is still great but it's not worth the wait .
Food are okay!! Staff are okay!! i hope that the staff are more attentive!! Everytime we come back their customer service is improving!

pho was just okay

I was surprised the bun bo hue had actual pork blood in it...most restaurants take this out so it doesn't freak out the non-Viet crowd

Heard this is some of the best local phó in vegas. 

Its location was in a not to crowded place plenty of parking unlike the rest of the phó places down the street in the little saigon shopping center.

upon entering the restaurant the smell phó broth and marinated beef hit you. The sound of clattering plates and glass cups chattering fills your ears. A sign of a good restaurant if you ask me. 

I ordered the pho dac biet with added meatball. The soup came less than 10 mins. Deff a good bowl of pho, i have no complaints.

Delicious and fresh, always keeping an eye out for good Vietnamese food! A few different Knox of spring rolls, even one you can make at your own table. Bun was delicious too.. Picture is of what was left, nothing!

After cruising the strip of Las Vegas, we were famished and ready for dinner. To beat the chilly and cold air of the night, my brother suggested pho. Being a person who's always looking for a good soup concoction to satisfy my hunger, I did not object.
As we entered, a server greeted us and brought us to a table. We stuck with the basic Vietnamese favorites and ordered pho, egg and shrimp rolls. The fried egg rolls came with plenty of vegetables which is always a plus especially the daikon, carrots and cucumbers. The vinegar sauce which I usually enjoy was very tasty as well. When our pho were served, it came with plenty of bean sprouts, mints and limes as well. The broth was very tasty and full of flavor but was warm instead of piping hot. The meat in my pho did not really cook well as a result of the warm broth. Nevertheless, I finished my pho with much gusto. Service wasn't as great but okay. I remember my brother asking for more napkins but his request was not given until about 10-15 minutes later after he asked.

My experience with this restaurant was pretty pleasurable and I think I'll be back again when given the chance.

Wow. What bad customer service! Not even a hello when we came in. Nobody had a smile on his or her face,  from waiter to owner/cashier. The ph was less than decent. My cousin could not finish his bowl. When we paid,  the change was thrown onto the counter instead of handing it to us.

My name is Gavin. I am a pho-a-holic. Let my share my story. 

I am a weekly regular here at Pho So1 for a reason! Having tried many pho places in LV, I keep coming back to this one for one thing...THE SOUP. This is the hands down best pho in Vegas. No questions. It's food crack, really. I just can't get enough. The broth has mystical powers and calls to me at strange times, begging for my return. The noodles and meat mingle in the bath of harmonious flavor and never fail to make me mmmmmmmm. Always order the Dac Biet #10 if you're really hungry or 14 if you're just normal. Tender brisket, delicious flank, melty chewy tendon and tripe if you want it. It's heaven in a bowl, baby. It'll cure what ails ya. Thank you Pho So1, for making me an addict.

Only words of wisdom, avoid the lunch rush on the weekend especially and order quickly.. Some days they get crazy busy and service suffers. Still, I love em to death.
The waitress or server was very rude and impatience. I would not eat here again. They also forget some of my order.

The lady at the bar acts like she is doing you a favor by being there.
Very rude when I went to pay the bill.
For the first 15 minutes I was there she was on the phone talking loudly not conducive to a relaxing meal.
The soup was greasy for beef pho.  For $10.00 it was not appetizing at all.
I will not go back.  This is the first and only poor review I have written.

The service is 4 stars and the food is 3 stars.
Came here twice after after a couple of nights of drinking and each time I had the Pho Ga, chicken noodle soup. Even though I had been drinking, I can still tell you that the Pho Ga was pretty good. The broth was not greasy and there was a generous amount of chicken that was given was not dry.  I am giving the staff 4 stars because I can't imagine how many drunk people come in to this restaurant and just give them a hard time. DRUNKS! No I was not one them. I am a happy drunk. It says a lot if I can say that there Pho Ga is comparable to the Pho Ga in the SF. The prices for their dishes are average, not too pricey. I also thought this restaurant was pretty clean. Good place to have a late night dinner after a night of partying, even though it's a way from the strip, but I suppose that can be appealing for some people.

Pho so 1 is my go to place for my crazy pho cravings! I am always willing to drive out of my way to come here. I get off work late and they are open even later. The staff is great and on point. I have never had a bad experience and I will continue to come here. I am usually always the only white person there and I love it.
This place Phokin stinks... Bad odor in the restaurant.  Service is bad! Staff makes you feel  pressured to get out. Food was not great... I'll  never  come back

Pretty decent pho and service is nice and attentive.  There is an absurd amount of MSG in their ingredients.  I've gone 2 times and both times have gotten severe headaches.  I don't have the same issue at other pho restaurants.  This place would be amazing without the MSG.

Been here several times in the past.  Whenever we come to visit Las Vegas from Los Angeles, we would go here for lunch.   However, we recently tried their Pho and it is not the same. They either lost the original cook or changed their recipe because it tasted terrible. I am Viet, in an LA area, I know good Pho when I taste it. Must find a new Pho place in Las Vegas.

Pho is the perfect breakfast for the morning after.  Love the fact that they open at 9:00 a.m.  In fact, I suspect they open earlier than that, because when we arrived at 9:00 a.m., there were 2-3 tables of families already eating.

1.   server walked  when we were still talking to her. 
2.   it took over 30 mins to get  the soup after order.
3.   After we done, we went to pay,  the  owner refuse  to show  the bill,  after 15 mins conversation  with the owner. finally  we got  our bill, and we found out the owner secretly over charged us $10. AND THE OWNER SAID: ITS NOT MY BAD, ITS MACHINES PROBLEM. 

THERES A LOT OF PHO RESTAURANTS IN CALGARY, 
DO NOT COME TO THIS ONE.

I should have walked out upon seeing a roach in the woman's bathroom but I was with a large party and didn't have that type of influence on them.  So I went ahead and placed my order, the vegetable pho.  The pho tasted okay.  I've had better, I've had worse.  My rating for the pho is 3 stars.  

The table next to use ordered something that required them to bbq at their table.  This restaurant has absolutely no ventilation system that gives them the right to allow bbq-ing at your table.  The smoke was trapped in the restaurant making your eyes hurt and difficult to breath.  When I mentioned this to the cashier, he acknowledged the lack of ventilation and apologized.  I got the impression that they are aware of  this issue but aren't interested in making any changes.  

After factoring in the roach and the lack of ventilation, they are down to 1 star.  Would give a 0 star if that was possible.

Very good food. Even better service. Clean, quick and good. We took a taxi from the strip, it was raining, we couldn't get a cab back. We were stuck there. The manager noticed we were just kind of stranded, standing in front of the restaurant. She came and asked if she could help. We told her the situation, she herself tried calling us a taxi to no avail. She had a bus boy give us a ride at that point. What amazing costumer service that was! Thank you!!

For the most part the food is good. Service needs a lot of work besides that fact it has the best Pho in town. We sat down today and no greeting from any waiters or waitresses. The waitress gave us napkins along with a used one that has lipstick marks all over it. Don't see language as a barrier since they all can speak and understand English pretty good. We still come back for food but don't bother saying thank you cause they won't acknowledge it.

Great food but one of their servers is really rude from the start to beginning. I had forgotten to ask for cooked bean sprout and was afraid because of the first impression so I decided to ask one of his coworkers. He came by to our table and asked if we were the one who asked for the cooked bean sprout and then told us he got yelled at for it thank you and gave us a  two thumbs up and proceeded to leave the table. We ended up not getting the cooked bean sprouts and didnt want to ask. The guy is about 5'5 skinny dark brown hair
 with bangs swept to the right. The coworker was lovely she had a piercing on her right short hair and average height.

Best pho in Vegas! I have been coming here since I was a kid and their eggrolls are by far the best. Always fresh and hot and not small skinny ones like you get at most pho restaurants. 

The pho is always good and the broth is the best I've had. The pork chops are yummy as well, but you have to have the eggrolls! I highly recommend this place for a good bowl oh pho, even late at night since they're open really late. Perfect late night snack!
Fast service, best pho around area. Don't even bother with Jenni Pho, service there is really slow.

This place is not going to impress you by it's looks.  It stands on it's food alone.  If you want something that'll make you cry because of how good it is, and at the same time make you scream because of how spicy hot it is (if you decide to be a hero and eat the chili) this place is for you.  They also have non-screaming dishes.

I've been visiting and ordering delivery from this place for about a year now.  It's among a bunch of other Vietnamese restaurants, but I choose this place always because they're close and super consistent and really good.

My favorite is the 15a which is the seafood pho.  It's always really good and way more than I can finish if I get the extra large, and I can eat a ton of food.

They always over estimate how long the food will take.  They usually say it'll be an hour and it's at my door in 30 minutes which makes me really happy.  Also, when you're at the restaurant the food is on the table in like 10 minutes.  It's always super fast.

Go here because it's tasty and you will love it.

I don't know what it was but when I ordered and my food brought to me everything was good but as I continued with my meal I became more and more unimpressed, and kinda grossed out...the flavour just was not for me.

It was very busy when I visited this place during lunch time. Pho soup was too salty to finish the whole thing. Vermicelli was OK, but I didn't  care for their sour sauce. It was a bit too sour for me. Spring rolls are good except for the fact that the peanut sauce was too watery for my taste. The price is reasonable. The service was not impressive.

Great Pho!  As a credible Pho expert recently explained to me, this is one of the two best places for Pho in Vegas.  Said Pho expert also explained that Pho is typically a breakfast item in Vietnam, so it's warm and filling, but not super heavy such that the rest of the day is shot, i.e., nap time!  That's particularly ideal for lunch time during the work week.  (Napping under your desk while boss passes by = bad news bears!) 

Apparently, this place uses less cinnamon and ginger in the Pho, so it's less "spicy."  That's fine by me, as I am not a fan of really spicy dishes.  (I spend more time drinking water than enjoying the food.)  Nonetheless, I still threw in a couple slices of  jalapeños into the soup for a slight kick.     

The portion sizes are hearty, and the ingredients are really fresh.  My fav is the rare beef and flank steak, although I've heard the brisket is also good.   

Also, try the fried rolls (ch giò) -- they're delicious!

This is a cool spot to come to when its late and you craving some pho.... But today was a bad nasty experience. ... We came in as usual but this time we came in with a friend recommending the place and well we ordered our food came then i saw it. A snail on my plate in my food alive !!!!!! That was nasty and all they dis was remove the plate and broght me back a side dish ..... I wasnt satified at all and i actually liked this spot but after this.... Yeah good bye

WORSE bowl of pho in Vegas. I ordered the rare beef pho. It came out lukewarm, so the broth wasn't hot enough to lightly cook the rare beef like it was supposed to. The blood from the rare meat started to run and coagulate, and made my broth so unappetizing that I lost my appetite.

This wasn't a one time thing. Last time there a few months ago, although all four people in my party ordered different kinds of pho, all bowls were bathwater temp.

I asked the supervisor at cash register about the lukewarm pho. He said the kitchen didn't put enough hot broth and next time to ask the server to take my bowl back for more broth. This is just sheer laziness...

The reason pho broth isn't hot is because they didn't heat up the noodles first, and didn't put enough broth to bring all other items to temperature. If the name of your restaurant literally means "Number 1 Pho", they should make sure that every single pho bowl that goes out of the kitchen is steaming hot, every single time, instead of relying on customers to ask them to heat it up a bit.

The only reason we go here is because of the DIY grill (#80, they bring out everything and you cook the meat at your table). 

The staff is non-Asian but they know the menu and the wide variety of sauces well, so I was impressed with that.

Shitty service.. Just want to call it how it is... First they got me sitting here in the coldest part of the restaurant... Then their tea taste like fuckin perfume... But u wanna know what really pissed me off? the fact that they gave me cold pho.. Like are u fucking kidding me?? It's already 34 degrees outside.. 

Not to mention my girlfriend ordered crispy noodle thing.. & didn't even get her food til after my other girlfriend was done with her pho.. Talk about bullshit... In the end It gave us a good laugh tho.. lol

I went to a new pho place last night and it was great!  Pho So 1 is great and to be truthfully honest I don't remember everything we had but I do remember that everything we did have was excellent!! We had some regular pho and a couple dishes that we shared (one was like a garlic beef dish and one was beef and vegetables and beef over yellow noodles).  Overall it was a great experience and I will definately go again!!
YUM!!!  Love #39 and #2.  Place needs better air conditioning.
Best place for pho.we are regulars here! We like tocome very late at night after work. They are very friendly, have great prices, and delicious food.
Love me some spring rolls there. Great place to take a date for an ice breaker while trying to make the rolls. Lol

This place used to be amazing but maybe they have new owners now, it has gone down hill! I ordered a pick up of rare beef satay an I agree with some of the previous posts that the older lady that gave me my order was miserable. When I got home I noticed they didn't include any of the satay spices and the broth was bland. Also, the meat (in the past pink and fresh) was a dark brown color, yuck. 
When I phoned to inform them of their mistake on leaving out the spices the lady argued with me and then hung up on me! Seemed like as soon as she got my money I didn't matter anymore. What kind of customer service is that?
I will not be back!

This place is best for Pho and Bo Nuong Vi or Grilled Beef. I have been eating in this establishing for 21 years. The food is very consistent, sumptuous portion and mouth-watering flavor. The servers are very nice and their foods come out real quick. Everyday is a Pho day and every night is Grilled Beef night. You can tell by the lines of people during lunch rush hour or dinner rush hour. For appetizer, I had eggroll. The eggroll is really authentic with all the exotic spice that should come with it. The stuffing is moist and yummy. I could tell there is a lot of pork and some exotic ingredient. For main course, I had Pho. I recall whenever I finished a bowl of Pho at Pho So 1, there was always some meat left. This means they really put lots of meat to enhance the flavor and the taste and at the same time fulfill our stomach. It is the best place for Vietnamese food and the best bang for the buck in my opinion.

My place to go for the best pho!
Great atmosphere super friendly staff. The owner was very nice noticing my beer taste and recommended his Golden Monkey which was great!
They have great selection in beers! Come try them out!

best pho in town :) i've tried pho kim long and pho saigon 8 but i always come back here! egg rolls, spring rolls, beef salad, pho, mi/hu tieu (flat noodle/egg noodle soup), french coffee, soda chanh (lemonade), and thit bo nuong (the beef you grill at your table) is all very very good. not as good as home cooking though :/

This place has faster and better service than Pho Kinh Do and Nem Nuong. They provide a good portion of meat in their beef noodle soup compared to other restaurants. The place is quite packed but they have enough staff that you can get faster service than other Pho places. 

Recommend: Rib eye Pho yummm!!

First of all, this place is filthy. So filthy that one would wish for the lighting you would find in an opium den of stygian ambience. The oil is so thick in the air and on the furnishings that (excuse me if you've heard this one before...) Exxon Valdez: the Sequel could happen at any moment if someone were to create a flicker or spark.

The food is mediocre (rough rib-eye, oily soup and vegetables anachronistic to our age), the prices fair (that's where the one star comes from) and the service non-existent. Okay, that was a hyperbole, as they brought me food and took my order prior, but nonetheless, I felt like I was in a certain Ralph Ellison novel minus the violent urge to stuff a waitstaff in my chimney. Seriously, I was treated like a negro during the antebellum South. Alas, I resist the urge to play the race card here, as I am black, and felt they treated everyone with the same disservice and surly attitudes.

This place is, how do you say, you know, not Sunni, but...
This is the worst phõ I have ever eaten ,don't know if this is a particular busy day before the new year but the broth is tasteless ,the meat portion is reasonable but overall deserve a one star.

Tried their rice vermicelli (chicken) with spring rolls for the first time tonight.  The food was excellent - best I've had in a long time.  The meat had a nice flavour and spiciness to it that was very enjoyable.  The peanuts were chopped nicely (not crumbs like at some other places).   Everything tasted really delicious.  Will definitely be back.  The only reason i didn't give a 5 star rating is because this is the only thing I've tried there so want more experiences there before I give a 5.

Spent the past weekend in Vegas and had to stop off to get some Pho. I remember visiting this location a few years back and that the food was reall to do. However, when I visited this time it was just wasn't to my expectation. We were seated fairly promptly, received our waters and then eventually got to order food. The waiter delivered our water and once I finished it it took a while before I was recognized and I had to ask the waiter directly for more. 

I ended up ordering the Pho Dac Biet Xe Lua and it just seemed like the meat was pre packed and thrown on. We ate, finished up and say there for a minute before going to the register to pay. Overall the experience just wasn't very appealing. Perhaps next time I visit it will be different.

As for Vietnamese Noodle Houses, this one only one I've ever been to that beats my mom's homemade Pho. Definitely worth the trek off the strip,  if you can make it in right before one as that's when the Pho tastes best. (OPEN til 3AM too!)

Vietnamese iced coffee for $3 is superb.

It can get super smokey if a lot of people have ordered bbq food at their table.

Otherwise a great place for a quick bite in Las Vegas Chinatown. I will be back here on my next Vegas trip.

What I love about this place is the reasonable price for the food. Vermicelli tends to be a hit or miss, but the Pho is amazing and tastes very good. The portions are great and staff are friendly. What I don't like about this place is the service :( ... The awful food/utensils kart that makes a loud noise as it carries the food around the large restaurant... Not to mention that the staff won't take away the dishes that are you done with so it just sits there. Overall good Pho but the place feels under staffed :(

This is the main place I go for authentic vietnamese. The people are nice and pretty fast service sometime when they are not slam.  The food is very good at a very reasonable price. Its a very relaxing atmosphere restaurant.

Never been disappointed here.  I flip flop back and forth between the pho (soup) and vermicelli noodle dishes.  The pho is offered in 3 sizes to suit your hunger appetite, not always offered at other Vietnamese restaurants.  The service is always fast and never a problem finding a seat.

Very bad service. Had hair in the pho, and messed up our orders. The pho itself was not good. My family used to come here every time they visit Vegas but this was my first (and last!) time and I am not the least bit impressed. Will not be coming back. You can give it a try if you want to eat in an old and dirty restaurant where the food isn't good and your requests are outright ignored.

I like to get pho here after drinking. Whether take out or eat in, it's good. It's good when I'm sober as well. The one problem I've noticed is the peanut sauce for the spring rolls always seems watered down.

This is the best place to go for pho and to make your own spring rolls. This is my husband & I's favorite place to get pho when we are craving it and my family didn't make it home made. The broth is on point, there is plenty of noodles and lots of meat! They never skimp out on pho. I don't know any other place where you can make your own spring roll other than home, so this place is so far the best. Fresh meat, vegetables, vermicelli noodles, and rice paper to put in hot water. Cool experience if you've never tried. 

++ they give you free hot tea
I will never come back to this restaurant again. The worst service I've ever experienced.  Watch out for being overcharged on your bill.

Worst restaurant I've ever been to. I'd recommend you go to the other nearby pho restaurants if you want decent food and service, because they lack both. For starters, I'm Vietnamese so I've been to numerous pho shops, but this is the first time there wasn't a vegetarian menu (a lot of Vietnamese people are Buddhist and follow a vegetarian diet, that's why there is always a separate menu). I would've left, but I was accompanied by 3 others that were hangry because we've been on the road for 8 hours. I politely asked if there was any way of taking meat out of a dish, and the most condescending and snobbish attitude came from our waiter. We finally settled that I could have stir fried veggies and tofu with rice, which I was thankful for. My friend ordered hot tea and got tap water with a lime slice in it.. in a plastic cup. What even? When we got our food, everything tasted terrible and not even mediocre at best. None of us finished our food. 

They didn't tell us to pay up front so when we asked for a check, we got attitude for it and then directed to the front counter. At the front counter was another rude man-child that had an equally condescending and snobbish attitude, if not worst than the waiter. He said he genuinely wanted to know about our experience. I perked up at this because I thought he was the only sincere person attending to us that night, but when we asked about why the tea was not tea, he (rudely) said it was because it was a free service, which I've never heard of- rather than giving us water with a lime slice in it when we order tea, why don't you just give us tea? We then asked why the waiter never came back to check up on us after giving us our food, then he prided himself in saying that he was an "asshole" like the waiter and that I should work here too, implying that I was also an asshole. 

TL;DR all of the employees need an attitude change or to find a different place to work that doesn't involve customer service, and work on making your pho taste better and not so watered down (in my case, you don't need to compensate tofu, rice, and veggies with 10lbs of salt).

We went on a Sunday night at around 10 pm and we were surprised to find this place jumping with activity. You sign your party in at the podium in front and wait to be seated, which only took around 5 minutes as they were cleaning off tables. We informed the server that it was our first time there and he didn't really say too much, so we ordered some jasmine tea and Vietnamese egg rolls as we were still deciding what we wanted for main dishes. The egg rolls come on a plate full of different greens and some julienne carrots.  As earlier stated, the place was jumping and our server was kind of running around, so we asked the guy who brought out the rolls how to eat them incorporating the greens. He said that you more or less make egg roll wraps, using the assorted greens and some provided sweet n sour sauce. My wife loved the taste of the wrap, but I preferred the egg roll just as it was with the sauce and some chili oil. After around 20 minutes or so, our server returned to take our order. Once again we mentioned that it was our first time, and he then proceeded to give us some suggestions from the menu. I ordered the #10 pho, which was a noodle soup with different types of beef. My wife ordered the #29, an udon noodle soup with pork and shrimp. I also ordered another side of noodles and a side order of grilled pork. After a short wait, we were served big bowls of piping hot noodle soup, along with our sides. In one word....YUM!! The soups were outstanding and the grilled pork was excellent!  The soups were accompanied by a plate of bean spouts, lime, thinly sliced jalapeños, and a few fresh herbs. I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for some inexpensive authentic Vietnamese pho. I only give it a 4 because it is a bit loud, the service was a tad slow, and the jasmine tea was unsweetened (expected it to be honey sweetened like other places).  Other than that, it's cheap, open until 3am, and it's delicious!! Happy dining everyone!!

This is my favorite pho restaurant! MY FAVORITE. It doesn't matter if you get pho, egg rolls, pork chops, vermicelli bowls, or whatever else here because it's all delicious. Your order is taken without much of a wait after you're seated, and the food comes out hot really quickly. Customer service isn't top notch, but then again, you're in Chinatown... What else did you expect?

i give 3 stars not because of the food, which i think it's really good.
but because of the lady server they have.
she's so rude not only once but everytime i go there.

I  came here for dinner on 5/26 with my guy and came back the following week on a Monday. This place is always busy. The service is pretty fast but they dont have good service. I ordered combination Pho as I always get. It tasted ok but after I finished I got so thirsty. i think they use MSG. I think they use MSG more than other Pho restaurant.

This is the worst vietnamese restaurant    I've been to. When I first entered, there was about 4 different people that came up to me and asked if I was ready to order in a spam of 5 mins. First time to eat at this restaurant 1/25.11@ 11:55pm. Food is good, but what a turn off when the owner/ manager let guests with a  dog eat on the plate and run around the restaurant..

Before, ordering soft noodle would yield a sort of fried pancake that was softened by the sauce poured over the entire dish, but now it's actually just soft rice noodle. Hoping I could find the same consistency in the noodle, I previously opted for the crispy choice, but that's actually just a cluster of fried noodles.

The spring rolls are still good - my brother's favorite - and the rice dishes are delicious, but the overall quality of ingredients and the amount of ingredients used has degraded quite a bit.

I would recommend this place to a friend looking for a pho restaurant outside of Chinatown, especially since it's not as busy as it used to be. Usually, it's a good place for a reasonably-priced quick, casual lunch with friends.

My girlfriend and I decided to try a new pho place in Vegas....or at least a different place than where we normally go but a name we were familiar with. 

Pho So 1 has a location in California located on Victory and Sepulveda blvd; and never have their quality ever disappointed me after many years of patronage.
So for the first time last night, we decided to switch gears and try Pho So 1 in Las Vegas from our usual Pho Kim Long.

Our expectations were that of what we were familiar with and accustomed to.
The place had all the right smells and the look typical of a Pho joint, I felt that this was going to be good.

My girlfriend ordered the grilled pork vermicelli and I ordered the pork chop and shredded pork with omelette dish.
Food arrived quick as it always usually does but already we were offput by the smell. There was something strange and we had noticed that in the menu as the menu items are different from their location in CA.
There was this smell coming from the food that just didn't seem right, which then led to the taste, then ultimately to how we felt after dinner.

I want to say that the pork items were probably bad for as I'm writing this review right now-my stomach is still feeling uneasy. My girlfriend felt the same way.

Her grilled pork vermicelli kinda had a lemongrass-like taste to it which we couldn't confirm if it was one of the ingredients used to flavor the pork, and as for mine it tasted something similar but more of pork that was spoiling. If you have ever left meat out or smelled spoiling meat then that is the picture in trying to paint for you in terms of taste and smell, it was not good and why I'm giving it a 1 star rating based solely on this experience.

We ended up eating what we could that wasn't meat, but by then we had felt that the meal was tainted and decided to just stop.
We still paid for our meal but it was truly not worth it as we would've been better off having McDonald's for dinner.

Ultimately it was my fault for wanting to venture out of the normal and breaking redundancy by going to a new place.
But had I not, I would've never had this experience to prove that once you've tried the best to just forget the rest.

I'll still go to Pho So 1 being that it's the CA location. But while in Vegas...I'll be going to its competitor.

Let me preface my review by saying this:  I learned to make pho broth in culinary school, so my first introduction to this broth spoiled me on the rest.  However, I'm in Vegas on vacation and am coming down with a cold, so any pho is good pho.

Appearance: we had breakfast at Pho So 1 at around 9:30 on a Tuesday morning.  Jadira is right, there is no host station when you walk in, so you just walk in there and stand confused until someone sees you and ushers you to a seat.  We were seated within 90 seconds, though.  This place is nice and clean, and everyone there was pleasant.

The service: prompt, English-speaking (for the most part), and our egg rolls came out at the same time as our soups.  Unlike most restaurants, we were never bothered once our food was delivered.  That was ok with me - I would have been happy to flag someone down if we needed anything more, and it's awkward trying to talk with a mouthful of noodles and broth running down your chin.  Besides, they really give you all the condiments and complements you need before you get your meal.  

The food: nice and hot.  We shared an eggroll appetizer, my husband had pho with flank and brisket, and I had pho with beef balls.  The balls were tasty, but I wasn't crazy about their texture.  The flank and brisket, along with the eggrolls, were great, with a good ratio of meat to fat.  The noodles had a good texture, and there were plenty of them.  Great big plate full of basil, sprouts, jalapenos, and lime just in case.

My complaint: The hardest thing to get just right, at least for me, is the broth.  Having been spoiled by my textbook broth, I like for it to be dark in color from onion and ginger brulee, and for it to have a strong aroma of beef balanced with the sachet spices.  Pho So 1 had only the latter - very aromatic but almost as light and clear as water.  

Bottom line: we're still looking for that perfect bowl of pho here in town, but you could do lots worse than Pho So 1.

To say this is the best pho place in Vegas, is sad. It used to be decent, but I ask you to try it out and see for yourself.

SETTING: Located in the same plaza as market 168 and Honey Pig, it has a fair amount of parking. Be careful on the weekends when it's super crowded and everyone's a crappy driver. Restaurant is open, spacious. Seats and tables are gross and sometimes sticky. 

Might be a bit of a wait depending on the time and day. Fridays, saturdays, all major holidays are pretty packed. 

SERVICE: Hit-or-miss normally. Late-nights are good from 8pm-ish onwards when it's got a good crowd going, but they're still attentive. 

Can be very annoying trying to grab their attention. Like some asian places, don't expect them to pander, smile, or be fluffy with you. Cultural thing? Slightly. In vietnam, it's normally very business-like in the sense that you go eat and get out. You've got places to be. Casual. Still respectful though. Nothing personal. 

Am I the ONLY one that finds it bizarre that they serve hot tea in regular-size beverage cups?! Where are my teacups and teapot?! Not a huge deal, but it's comical to me. 

FOOD: one issue I've had consistently with the place for several years is the temperature of the broth. They either serve it slightly warm or barely hot. You might think this isn't an issue. Good pho is HOT (still shy of boiling hot) throughout the whole time you eat it and doesn't grow cold when you're almost or halfway finished. It also serves to cook your thin meat slices in there. I can't tell you how many times my pho has come out barely warm.

If your pho comes out tongue-ready without having to blow on it (sorry, couldn't word that any differently :/ ), then they're doing it WRONG. Ruins the experience.

Broth is normally flavorful for me, but nothing spectacular like "OH MY GOSH this is UH-MAZE-ING." I like to eat it as-is before manipulating it with hoisin and hot sauce. Whenever it is packed here, the food suffers. It's a pretty huge difference. Meat is fine, but I've found it oddly too tough sometimes. Hu tieu mi is one of my fave noodle soups, and they do a decent version of it. However, they LOAD so much into a bowl that it spills when I put my spoon and chopsticks in.

Would I call this perfect or even the best pho in Vegas? No. It's mediocre bordering on okay, but I'm happy this place has some awesome love for it. I'd rather stay at home and make my own, honestly. Am I being elitist about this? Maybe. I've just had decent or excellent pho since I was kid to know the difference in quality.

PROS: open late nights for the bar/club crowd and night owls. Okay pho, but seriously overrated. Good portions for both small and large bowls.

CONS: service. The food. 

VERDICT: Okay food for the price. Affordable. Great option for when you're craving food to soak up all that alcohol late nights. If you're not super picky or don't care, it's an okay place to go. Far from the best, but still better than the worst.
The food is good but the server is really badly when they come and check on you and if you want some more seem like they not be or they walk away when you haven't done telling them what you need

This is one of the few Vietnamese places in south Calgary. I mainly choose this place for convenience. Their pho is tasty enough as are the springs roles and bun. The flavour is good enough so if you're short on time, this is a decent spot for a quick bowl of pho.

Terrible service. The lady at the bar (the owner) is rude, service is slow and they brought out pork dumplings when we ordered vegetarian. We asked nicely to get the veggie that we ordered but she refused and argued shamelessley then swore at us. Honestly the worst service I've ever received. She was more concerned with losing the cost of the dish rather than correcting her mistake. Plenty of better options available, don't waste your time here unless you want to ruin your evening! Would absolutely give zero stars if I could.

This WAS my favorite Vietnamese restaurant. Until one late night when I brought my family from California here, bragging to them that this was the best place in Las Vegas. Service was horrendous. I ordered the beef stew with egg noodle soup. I cannot believe they let this out of the kitchen. It looked like watered down beef boullion cubes with hard fatty beef.It was gross....I pretended that I enjoyed it just to save face. I don't understand. I've had this dish hundreds of times and it was always spot on. I've been a loyal pho so 1 customer since 1998. I'm astonihhed that they served such horrible food. Maybe ...it was a fluke but not to be harsh. I expect better...way better. Pho so 1 ship shape up and get your act together because Saigon # 8 is right down the street!!!!
Flavorful food, great value and awesome quality of food. Service is good. Sometimes the place is a little less than sparkling clean but it's no big deal to me. Parking at the back!

Excellent service! Staff was super friendly and helpful. I've been to other pho restaurants in Chinatown and was not too impressed with service or staff, but this spot is a keeper!  Will be back again  for sure!

The dudes at Pho So 1 are always on point . Iv been going here for years . If I want Vietnamese food I head over to get my fix whatever it may be, beef stew , steak and rice , spring rolls and the egg rolls !!! The BEST EGG ROLLS IN TOWN.  Vietnamese done right

Whenever I'm craving pho I visit this restaurant. The service is good and the place is nicely furnished. I almost alwayd order a large bowl of pho, which is usually quite delicious. The soup is very flavorful and the noodles aren't hard or undercooked. Comes with a small plate of bean sprouts and lime wedges and chilis. Prices are reasonable for the quality of food. However, once I found my soup rather salty and too flavorful.

This place is dirty, the floor is sticky, and I'm not a fan of leaving a restaurant and having the smell of the place penetrate through my clothes, hair and skin.  Yuck. But I will be honest, I'm not a fan of "hole in the wall" places, like my brother-in-law who says the dirtier the place, the better the food.  So the food may be decent or even good as other reviewers have written, but I just can't get past the interior.

Not only is the service horrible, the food is subpar. The pho broth has a very strong star anise presence which some may love but I'm not into that. The charbroiled pork chop was super dry and the shredded pork thing that it came with was unappetizing. I will not be coming back
Favorite pho restaurant! This place is the first thing that comes to mind when i think of pho. Service is okay, but the food is excellent!!

Been around for years if you haven't been and love Vietnamese cuisine give this place a shot.I came here with my family for Valentines Day. Thinking more about how it should be about a family being together than flowers and candy. Every restaurant in town was obviously packed. Wife wanted Noodles so here we went. To my surprise it was the busiest I have ever seen it. A few couples bust most of the tables were filled with families. Many others has the exact same idea I had. The one great thing about a busy business is you know, most likely you are getting everything fresh. The oly crazy thing that happened was when the manager went to the back and yelled "What the F is going on?" When things get busy, mistakes are easily made. It was more fun than anything. Waiter was top notch. Was the kind who tried to remember your entire order without writing it down. Hours later and I am still full. I can't wait til next Valentines day.

I believe that my taste buds changed because I used to really like this Vietnamese restaurant.  It is very authentic but my taste preference changed overtime.  For those who like pho, this is a good place to go to.  The only vegan option, I think, is there tofu vermicelli bowl.  I am not vegan but I thought I'd share that especially for that one person in a group that needs to know, "is there a vegan option?"...

This place has been newly renovated and it's my first time being back since! It looks much more modern and much cleaner. I've always loved the food and now, I'll enjoy it so much more with the great atmosphere. I come here for the pho! And I love it so much. It's very traditional and it's extremely delicious. I highly recommend you come here! Especially during a late night craving! They're open late which is the best part!

This place is horrible they charge you $1 for sliced onions and if you order more they charge you another dollar... Once I asked them for an ice tea and charged me $4 when you can get hot tea for free and add ice. They charged me ice for $4!  Poor customer service they just looking to charge you any kind of way. .. They also use a stove on the tables which is ILLEGAL! One wrong move and that stove can actually blow up! But if you do come here (which I recommend not to) be careful because they can charge you for anything and ALWAYS CHECK YOUR BILL. YOU NEVER KNOW WHAT THEY COULD HAVE CHARGED!!! IF I COULD GIVE THIS ZERO STARS I WOULD!!! NEVER COMING BACK!!!

We came here literally because of the Pho So 1 in Van Nuys. We are such fans of the van nuys location that we went out of our way during our trip to Vegas to eat here. They are under the same ownership but this one is understandably not the same as the Van Nuys location. Still great pho though!
Worst place ever. Worst service ever. Will never go again. Servers were straight up rude. Took forever to get food. Cancelled half my order cause it took so long.

After landing in Vegas we headed for food in Chinatown which is Spring Mtn Rd.  Pho So 1 is in the Big Lot strip mall with a Vietnamese grocery store: LV Superstore next to it.

We got:

Iced coffee - they gave us the drip coffee w/ filter so it's legit.  Good.
Bi Cuon - not what I wanted & not very good.  Fresh spring roll w/ pork fuzz I guess.
Grilled Pork & grilled shrimp cold vermicelli - fine, comes w/ fish sauce.
B. got a pho - he liked it.

They take credit card.  Very popular place.

Location: Better than the majority of the other Pho place. Ample parking. 
Wait time: 10-15 minute at times. 
Service: Prompt, Server knowledgeable. Friendly.
Decor: Acceptable. The place is old. 

Food:
Spring Roll: Good. Wasnt too soggy and rubbery. 
Peanut sauce:Excellent
BBQ Pork Vermicelli: Excellent. Flavorful. Portion:Good
Pho: Good.Wasnt too greasy. Meat:Good

Overall experience: Good.
I give it 4.5. Why not 5? Because of the decor =-D.
Strictly food; Excellent

Will return again.

Just what the doctor ordered, for a hangover.
Very clean place, great selection of food. I got rib-eye steak pho. It was nice and greasy (in a good way). They don't skimp in the meat at all. The flavor was perfect. I also had the egg rolls. They were crunchy and hot. All of the veggies were fresh.

I'm a fan only when I am in Vegas partying or visiting family. My family always go to Pho Kim Long, but finally they tried this place and it's so much better. The broth here is savory and not salty. My goodness they load your bowl with noodles and meat that I couldn't finish it, but it's worth what you spend. The only problem I have with this place is their service, their servers do not come around to fill up the waters..argh..I hate that especially, when it's hot and spicy with siracha.

UPDATE Spring/Summer 2016
One of the few pho places open late that is priced right and tastes good, with also good portions. Soup to noodles to meat ratio. Still tastes awesome. Spring rolls are just ok. But the take out spend, wow. Very quick. Worth the drive each time. Yums. 
They are now near the top of my list for pho places for sure. 

UPDATE June 2014
I do not like this place at all anymore. Go someone else. 

BAD SERVICE, ok food. They have great pho hands down almost close to the pho place I loved back home in Hawaii but the service was horrible!!! Even as an Asian person in there, I felt I was invisible. Three tables that were sat after us was served before us. It took 3 different people's attention before my husband finally got his soda.  I understand they were busy and the food came out quick, but the service was the worst I have experienced in a long time.  It was also super hot, they had 2 fans on but felt like there was no ac running, which made it even more uncomfortable and the experience unpleasant. It was cooler outside! I  would never dine in again maybe only take out.  It's a shame because the food rocked. I want to try again but not sure I would ever dine in again. Take out sounds better but of course it doesn't give you that Pho experience you want when you want that hot brothy soup.

I've been back to try the Vietnamese BBQ and all I can say is daaaammnn Geeenaa!

When the little grill and tons of plates of "stuff" arrived at my table, I was completely lost.  I looked around at the smiling faces of successful grillers, and thought, "I want to be just like that guy, only without the mustache."  I had to ask my server for instructions.

I'm going to break it down for you so you're prepared to get crazy with your dinner:

You will get a plate of beef and shrimp, (order this one, both proteins were great) lettuce, mint, limes, onions, and jalapenos, (like with pho) some peanut sauce and some fish sauce for dipping, a bowl of hot water, and finally, little clear pieces of paper (rice wrappers)

Here's what you do:

1)  Squeeze some lime on your meats, because errrthing's better with lime.
2)  Dip your meats in the oil which is in the little reservoir around the grill, then place on the grill, cook to your liking.
3) Dip rice wrappers in hot water to reconstitute them, then lay on your plate.  
4) Fill wrapper with lettuce, mint, jalapenos, carrots
5)  Put freshly cooked meat in wrapper.
6) Wrap it up like a burrito
7)  Enjoy the HELL out of that delicious little thang!


I was with some friends, and we thought it was hilarious to call these things "tacos."  We had a few drinks, so I'm sure it wasn't funny at all, but let's go ahead and just roll with it. 

Even though we left the table an absolute mess, the food was great and the experience was fun.  We'll definitely be back soon my Vietnamese friends!

I absolutely love this place . I've gone to many other places Jenni pho grill , old pho Saigon , pho sing sing , and little old Saigon those place are not bad but pho so 1 has the best egg rolls and the best pho  .

Love love love! Finally found some Pho to write home about. Few things in this world make me happy like pho does, I don't know why but there is something about shoving my face in a bowl of steaming broth and noodles that just puts a smile on my face. Works everytime.

The rest of the folks really nailied this place already so I don't actually have much to add. Good clean broth with a lovely fragrance, tons of noodles, and of course the sprouts, basil and lime on the side. 

One bonus this place has is that you can choose from 3 sizes of pho to satisfy your appetite. I ordered the small - and it was to much for me as it was. We also had some fresh rolls, but really the Pho was the focal point. 

I say don't go for the noodle bowl but hit this place for pho.

Also, you can park behind and there is also a back door to the resto.

The place was clean service  was excellent, very fast. The pho  was great! The broth was flavorful not salty. I was able to add the hot sauce, veggies,  and a little soy sauce without  it overpowering  the taste  of the rare meat. The broth was very hot  as well. The Spring Rolls Were fresh. The meat egg rolls with the veggie wrap plus mint leaves sure hit the spot. The staff Is multicultural  with very nice customer service.
The noodles on our pho is hard and not cooked well. Soup smells stinky

YES GO HERE GO HERE!!! The ONLY good pho place in town, PROMISE!  It can get pretty packed, but its well worth the wait for us :) You also get a decent bang for the buck here. Ive always ordered seafood pho, and they are not stingy with the good stuff. Ive recently starting expanding my horizons and explored other dishes on the menu, they are alway on point. Open late, great place!

Pho: salty broth, wasn't very hot and meat was too chewy. I got the special with added ribeye and the only edible meat was the ribeye... awful. 

Fried egg roll came late and wasn't even hot...with pockets of Luke warm frying oil in the skin.. ugh gross. The meat in egg roll tasted old too... I had to spit it out (dramatic I know) but I can't handle old smelling meat. 

Fried rice was tasteless and very very late.

Service was normal for a viet place

Honestly... I will never be back!

The food taste so good!! The pho is always good. Egg rolls, spring rolls, shrimp paste, and even the tea is really good. But every time we eat here we get instantly sick! Im so torn, because it taste so good but hurts so bad. But I'd rather not pay to get sick. They must not wash their hands or keep food at right temp.
Ordered the egg roll and baby tiny roach were crawling around the plate!!! I would never ever come back here!!!

If you are craving for a decent Pho place in town then this is it. The broth is tasy and the noodles are chewy. This place is always packed. We always order extra onions on the side coz with a little lemon and pepper on top, they get pretty tasty. The perfect accompagnement for Pho.
 
PS: They open pretty late as well.

Not much to say about this place other than the fact that they have the best flavored pho I've had in Las Vegas. I've tried several different bowls of pho but their broth is always delicious. 

Service sucks though.

Very yummy! Our favorites are the #12 pho  and spring rolls with peanut sauce. 
Only thing Is the bathrooms are always filthy so either use the restroom before you arrive and bring some hand sanitizer so you don't have to go into the restrooms, only reason I deducted a star.
read the reviews prior and expectations were high. the pho did not disappoint. everything was excellent. will be back next time visiting Vegas.
The concierge at the Venetian recommended this restaurant. The soup was very tasty, and the bean sprouts were all trimmed and everything! Inexpensive and very soothing after a night out ;)

Terrible service.  I'm used to bad service at Asian restaurants, but this was ridiculous.

Order 2 pork chop rice dishes and asked for an egg on top.  They both came out, no egg.  We had to ask twice for egg.  One egg came out . . and we had to wait for the other one.  They also didn't give us a steak knife to cut the pork chop.

I ordered a Hu Tieu in broth with glass noodles.   The noodles were under cooked and the soup wasn't very hot.

Ordered Goi cuon.  Never came out even though we asked 3 times, we just canceled it.

I'm not looking for fancy pants service and charming waiters, just bring us our food.

Also seems slightly pricey for mediocre food.  We're sticking with the Rio Buffet from now on.

Everything I have had here has been great. I keep going back and I bring everyone that visits town. Its open late so if you want an after midnight snack or after the club meal they will gladly seat you and provide good service. 

Good broth, fresh ingredients. Service always good. The place has a cafeteria feel rather than the fine dining feel that a lot of businesses in Las Vegas go for. But, which would you rather have? Great food or a great scenery?  

I usually get the beef pho with tendon and flank. If I feel like rice I get the bbq pork plate with the egg loaf. Good Stuff! Enjoy.

Lukewarm pho - i think our soups had been sitting out in the kitchen for awhile. Really bad and slow service. Won't be back.
The table next to us remained dirty the whole time we were there. It was really gross.

Deserves 0 star. We often come here but today we found a huge dead fly in the vegetables. They replaced it but they never even apologized. We ate a few pieces before finding it which worries me because I don't want any of us getting sick. The worst thing through this experience is how the cashier which I believe is the owner treated us after letting her know what had happened. I will never go back to this place and I will let my family and friends know.
Service lacks efficiency. Long waiting time for getting served when busy. Need more employees for ampunt of customers. Bathrooms needs attention.

Horrible service and Pho was disappointing.  Not sure how this place gets good reviews, it was crowded, waited to be seated and finally after 20 minutes of staring at a couple of empty tables and trying to make eye contact with the many servers we were seated.  Menus were literally dropped on our table and as we were about to walk out one of the servers came by to take our order.  Grilled pork spring roll was pretty good, Pho was not!  Watery soup, not the rich broth expected from a good pho, chewy meat, and overcooked noodles.  Not going back and will never recommend this place!  Go somewhere else!
Hands down, my favorite Pho spot in Vegas. I always get the Grilled Pork Vermacelli bowl. I take all my friends there. Quick service and delicious food!

We went in January 1st. The first meal of the year, woah oh woah, the worst restaurant i have ever been to. I understand that a lot of people was waiting but the restaurant has absolutely no system. We dont know where to go for signing up because nobody is up front. When somebody actually showed up, he ignored our existence until i asked him. The wait was not bad. But other customer was fighting over that table as well. The hostess let us resolve it among ourselves. I mean, really? Anyhow, we got the table. The table is dirty and smelly. We sat down and waited, and waited. 20 mins later, finally somebody gave us menu to order. Everybody in my table asked for ph. I asked for cháo ( porridge). He said  cháo takes a lot longer to make in a really sarcastic way, which i didnt appreciate at all. So i ordered ph. Food didnt take long to come. And the waiter forgot my order. I had to remind him to bring my food. So everybody in my table finished their food before i got mine. The broth is actually pretty good. That is the only reason why i gave it 1 star. In conclusion, i dont think i will ever come back here.

I tried this restaurant while I was in town for the New Year holiday; I thought the food was great, authentic, and priced fairly.  The portions were just the right amount for me (since I ordered appetizer, main, dessert, and a drink), but the individual dishes are slightly smaller than what I am accustomed to from other Vietnamese restaurants.  Flavor, however, was great on everything I had on both my visits here.  The food tasted quite fresh and service was quite good.  Even though this place was crowded with a line out the door, service is managed well enough that we didn't have to wait much to get a table nor to get our food.

Lots of parking available. Ordered pho special with beef on the side....okay, broth was a bit oily and our waiter barely was around to check on us or refill our water. Also ordered crispy fried noodle with seafood but who serves shrimp with beef and chicken? My husband didn't want to make  big deal out of it so he ate it...although he was in the mood for seafood and not beef and chicken! We have had better experience with pho on Oahu, even my son knows what great pho tastes like and he orders it exactly like me, pho special with rare beef on side. Customer service needs work.

Good solid food. 

Not much I can say about this place. They worked fast to clean the tables for us and within seconds of sitting down, we were already asked if we were ready to order. Nope. Need a few more minutes please. Okay. 

I got their beef ball noodle soup. Honestly, the pho taste just like every other pho place I been to. Nothing out of the ordinary, but their beef balls were kind of hard to chew. The only thing I really liked about this place was their egg rolls which had a good amount of flavor in it. 

Overall, I'll give this place 3 stars. The food wasn't totally extraordinary but it was good and the prices are affordable.

I will admit I used to cringe when my husband would tell me we were coming here for or lunch or dinner before.  But now that they have new owners and have remodeled the place and changed up the menu a little, I can honestly say I am actually looking forward to going back.  They have added two big screen televisions.  They now have wooden bench style tables and they play hip hop music.  When we arrived a couple of the waiters were dancing and one even danced us on in to our table (he was feeling it).  I ordered the roasted hen with a side of egg noodles the noodles had a sweet brown sauce on them with a kick to it, and a small bowl of soup.  To my surprise it was rather tasty the roasted hen was seasoned perfectly and crispy but the inside was not dry.  My kids shared the roasted hen and tomato rice place and enjoyed it as well.  My other daughter got steamed rice and beef and broccoli, that was enough to feed two people easy.  My husband got steamed rice with pork and egg loaf.  It was all good.  I also had, well my kids actually had the three bean drink, so good.  Next time I will make sure to order two.

The best pho and egg rolls in the area. If you like egg rolls, they have the best! The egg rolls come in an order of 4 pieces with lots of fresh vegetables. Big portions for the prices. 
The service is average.

One of the "oldest" pho restaurants in town. Believed to have been here probably around 20 years or so. I moved to Las Vegas in Dec 1993. I've always remembered it being there since i moved here, and thats a minimum of 16 years. 

This restaurant is a popular favorite when it comes to vietnamese food. Wide selection of different foods on their menu listing to almost 100 items like pho, bun, com... appetizers like spring rolls and cha gio (viet style egg rolls) 

Service is pretty decent. The owner (or owner's son? whoever it may be... young mid aged maybe high 20s guy) is really nice. 

One of my favorite few things to order is the #10 which is the special pho with combination of beef... good sized bowl for a large. decent amount of noodles and meat. usually comes out pretty fast and hot. a fav during the year, esp during the cold times to warm up ! 

another one is #54? which is the bun thit nuong cha gio... rice vermicelli noodles with viet egg rolls and barbequed pork on top of greens and eaten with their mixture of fish sauce ! one i like to order over the summer or when its hot... nice cold noodle (no soup base)

one other favorite i order a lot is Bun Rieu... its a special soup based noodle soup that uses tomato as a base for soup and crab meat... also have a few cubes of cooked pork blood as well... very tasty.. takes a while to make compared to #10 or #54 but its worth the wait... most of the soup is usually gone by the time i finish this =]

popular place for pho by many people of different ages... open late to like i believe 2am? busy during prime hours. 

one little con is they dont have a really good air ventilation system... sometimes can be a little hot or stuffy or have a little KBBQ feel when someone around you has gotten the beef plate to grill at table.. but dont let this stop u from going to this place..

one pro to mention is this place is bill splitting friendly... for those who like to pay for their own order when sitting in a group.. =]
My new Pho stop when I get in town, love the broth, good service, always find a table.  good portions of meat.

I love Pho Meatball Soup and this place delivers. It isnt the best I have had ever but its the best I have had in Vegas. Pho in Seattle is everywhere and the market is developed where Vegas is much more limited in selections of Pho. The places here seem to be a bit less in quality than Seattle because their isn't the stiff competition, but this place was pretty tasty. I had #16 Pho w Meatball and I had the tendon one a day or two later. Both were very good and was what should be expected. I have not ventured into much else on the menu yet, but I would highly recommend, as for Las Vegas Pho this does the job pretty well.

This is probably one of the best Pho shops in Vegas, even compared to San Diego. I ordered the Pho Dac Biet Xe Lua, the whole dish and my party of 15 said that the food was fresh. We were not happy that the Che Ba Mau (3 Color Bean) did not have as much coconut in one of them and the waiter came over said no worries, not a problem. you want me to add more or get you a whole new one. Its very easy. Great customer service, but obviously theres a wait for this restaurant. (which is normal in vegas.)

Below average foods and bad services. Won't come back again.! Waiting for hour for an spring rolls and it came out cold. It's looked like it's been it the fridge. I had to remind them all the time that we still missing orders.

Strange that our last meal in Vegas was at a Vietnamese restaurant, but after binge eating other foods, my family and I were really craving it. Pho So 1 is a medium sized restaurant that was fairly crowded for a weeknight and pretty clean as well. We were promptly seated, and food came out pretty quick.

I had the Pho Tai, and to be honest, I was disappointed in it. While they gave a ton of meat that was fairly tender, the broth tasted very watered down. The egg rolls I ordered were also pretty large, but a bit too greasy for my taste. Finally, when I think Vietnamese iced coffee, I think a very strong and sugary coffee from the condensed milk. Sadly, my coffee was more on the bitter side. 

Pho So 1 is a good place if you want a large portion size for your Vietnamese food. That being said, the quality of the food could be better. 
Service 3/5
Ambiance 3/5
Food 2.5/5

Most definitely worth driving a little farther down spring mountain to get here. 

- parking lot is bigger and bigger is always better..to avoid bad drivers and for more parking spaces, of course.
- no wait like the one you always get at pho kim long.
- they give you TONS of meat in your pho. 


Happy recovery!

After reading the reviews on this place I thought it was going to be better than all the other pho places in vegas but it was just ok.

I ordered pho tai sach (rare beef and tripe) w/my beef on the side. It came out quick, just a few minutes after I ordered. The bowl was small. They did however give more beef than any of the other pho places. The soup tasted good, but it was warm. Since the soup was not steaming hot, I had to dump all the beef in the bowl right away which i usually don't do.

This is our go-to pho spot in Vegas. Now when reviewing fast food restaurants, what merits 5 stars is obviously going to be different when compared to, say, a sit down fancy pants restaurant where you take your lady friends (only to be friend zoned later... sucka).

Therefore, I wasn't surprised to see the dearth of more enthusiastic 5-star reviews for what may be the best pho place off the vegas strip. I've been to 4 other places during my multiple trips out to the desert and this is the only place that I wanted to come back to. Plus my viet gambling friends always take me here so that has to mean something.

It is hard to mess up pho - all you really need is great soup and this place has it. Last time I tried a pan-fried beef dish with tomato rice (I believe it's #21 on their menu) and the beef was moist and flavorful. I couldn't really taste any tomato in the rice but who gives a shit, it's just rice. The sweet pickled veggies complemented the dish well plus you get a bowl of their awesome soup.

Service is good and you pay at the back after you're done with your meal. I know I'll be back in my next trip. Till then, best of luck to ya'll out there in sin city.
i love pho so 1 but they gotta keep the place clean..seriously

My fiancé and I both love going out late night and getting us some Vietnamese food. I personally am a big fan of Pho (as this is my third yelp on a vietnamese restaurant). I was introduced to this particular place because I use to date the owner's son. I had never had pho prior. The establishment has flourished since then. The restaurant has doubled in size in 2002.

My fiance says that this is his favorite place for Cum Bo Lu Lac. Its basically barbequed beef and rice (i believe). I happen to like their jellyfish salad. The pickled favor is not overwhelming. 

 The pho is on par with most pho restaurants I have eaten. Price is also very reasonable, I think it was $6 for a bowl of pho which is around the going rate. Fresh spring rolls were very good too. 

Some people have mentioned that the place wasn't very clean. I would like everyone to keep in mind that most authentic Vietnamese restaurants aren't going to be very upscale and /or clean. Not that this is an excuse for hygiene, but I like to review on subjectivity. This is how most Vietnamese restaurants are, no boujie-ness but great food. If you're looking for an elegant Vietnamese restaurant, I can say, from experience, that the food will be over priced for exactly the same product from a mom/pop pho restaurant.

This restaurant isnt open as late as Pho Kim Long, but it is great. Last time I checked, they only took cash. So make sure to make cash on you.

YES! I haven't been here in about 2 years. Not sure if they got new owners or just changed things a bit. Looks more upscale inside than it did before, and service was awesome! Our food was out so fast that we were shocked. They kept checking on us to make sure we were good, drinks were refilled before they were even empty. When you're looking for good pho, it's all about the broth. I LOVE their broth. I could sit there and just drink a big bowl of it. I ordered the 13, beef brisket and flank. There was a TON of meat in my soup and it was so good. This place remains my fav pho spot. Phocking delicious ;)

Pho So 1 is thespot!! If you want some good pho this the right place.This a happening spot and gets busy real fast during peak dinner hours and weekends however its worth the wait!! the staff takes care of you right away!!

I always review based on a restaurant's food, customer service, price, and ambiance. 

Starting with the food, my pork chop over rice was really dry and the portion was small. My mom ordered their classic beef flank pho was below standard in my opinion.  The beef was old and dry. 

Customer service was not up to par either. The wait to be seated took about 15 minutes. I get that it was the weekend but that was no excuse for the poor flow of the restaurant. I only saw two bus-boys cleaning up the whole store. And there were plenty of empty tables but too short-handed to clean up, leaving many customers waiting outside. When it was finally my turn to be seated, the waiter had really bad attitude. 

For such a small portion, the price was so not worth it! Even the price in New York was cheaper than this place! 

I felt really bad for the workers because I felt like this place was short staffed. Leaving the store crowded and poorly ordered. Many angry customers were waiting by the door with me. 

Hopefully some changes would be made!

Wow~ Vegas, you have impressed me this time!

Pho So 1 serves variety of Vietnamese food, including Vietnamese BBQ, rice dishes, and other noodle dishes.  http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/2irb7bL821PjTTokp9GNSQ/l I was tempted to try something else (Especially since we went there 2 days in a row) but after all the crazy nights of drinking... I had to get Pho. The service here is a bit slow and this is where they lose their one star. :(  But the egg rolls here deserves the rest of the stars!

Pho here is pretty good. http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/iXb1PCDpvJI5y95O4Bob_A/l  Not the best ever, but it's pretty awesome.  Summer roll is VERY fresh.  Lots of basil and cilantro with shrimps that were pretty big and plump.  The egg rolls??? OMG.... I want to go back for some more egg rolls.  http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/4l3Um2jUW1lG7U82B-qMDw/l I don't really know what it is about the egg rolls here, but it was just so tasty.  SO good....

Best cure for a hangover.  They have enough seats to seat 10+ ppl to a table.  Thanks Pho So 1 for your awesome awesome egg rolls!! :)

9 times out 10 this place usually gets the 4-5 star mark on their chicken pho. This was probably the 10th. Really dissapointed on a recent trip.

Chicken Pho - Usually I order this because the beef pho is lukewarm at this place due to the high volume (which isn't really an excuse because Pho Saigon 8 does pretty big numbers as well, and their pho is always piping hot.) Not only was their soup lukewarm as well, but the chicken was overcooked. Sigh. Don't even want to think about it. Will give them another chance but kinda on the edge right now. lol

Overpriced and poor quality. Their nem nuong cuon was pathetic. The meat was stale, and falls apart when you bite into it. It was about $6 and some change for an order of 2 rolls. I got the pho ga. It was ok. They gave me a lot of chicken meat though. My girlfriend's broth tasted like there was still soap in it. Guess they're pretty clean.
Excellent Vietnamese food and great service.  The pho and egg rolls are amazing!!  Will definitely come back.. :)
I ordered the Vietnamese pork chop with rice and the fucking pork chops came out to look like some god damn beef jerky. Jack Links beef jerky tastes better than this trash. Very disappointed.
I like their pho. I like their expansive menu. I usually get vermicelli dishes here. And they're pretty good.

According to my friend, Pho So 1 is one of the oldest Pho places in Las Vegas. Well I guess that's why their Pho is so good. They've been doing it for so long that it's like second nature to make good Pho.

This is my favorite Pho place in Las Vegas. I come here so often that certain servers see me and they already have my order written down before I'm even seated (true story :P)

My favorite thing to order is item #12 a.k.a. Pho Tai Nam. I like to order the rare steak that comes with it on the side then let it soak in lime juice that way when i put it in my soup it's still a little pink by the time I get to eat it. Along with that I get the eggrolls (item #1) because they are SO DAMN GOOD. Not once have I ever visited and left disappointed with the eggrolls. They are consistently amazing every single time. They come with a decent portion of lettuce and veggies and what I do (if you've never tried) is take the eggroll and some veggies and roll it up in the lettuce leaf like a wrap, dip it in the sauce they give you and VOILA! taste bud orgasm.

I gave it a 4 because some days, the service just downright sucks lol. It's okay though, the food ALWAYS makes up for it in the end.

Out of townies. This is 10-15 minutes off the strip. Do yourself a favor and get your ass over here. lol.

I'm not quite sure what happened to this place. I've visited here plenty of times in the past 6 years and its been a hit or miss now. I experience bad service every time we eat in and now we do take outs late at night because they seem to be the only place opened so late. I noticed the pho is better to take home and add your own ingredients given you have them. The eggrolls are usually good and my favorites to get are any of the vermicelli noodle plates. I've tried a lot of the items on the menu but I just stick to my usuals most of the time.

As a fellow Vietnamese, I am aware of what good Pho should taste like and clearly Pho So 1 (Pho #1) lives up to it's name. 

Your typical Vietnamese Pho house decoration with simple table (plenty) settings and menu. Servers are prompt and cleanliness is acceptable. If you struggle on which kind of Pho you'd like, be adventurous and pick the Pho Dac Biet (Pho Special)! Warning, the bowls are eye-popping big, regardless if you order a Special or not! As the beautiful Pho lands on your table, the broth is hot enough to open up your pores, the aroma is rich enough that it could suffocate your nose, colorful display with very little floating oil, now the important part (**drum roll please**), once again the broth is hot enough to burn your tongue but the taste is truly a blast full of flavors with no Sriracha hot sauce or lemon required. Typically, you will get an after taste (from MSG!!) in some Pho houses but Pho So 1 leaves your mouth tastefully wanting for more, truly a work of art!

Hooray, Pho doesn't get any better than this! Stop by if you're in town, hungry after the gambling, or just hungry. 

Absolute LOVE.

Fast service...the food is okay nothing special.  The egg roll is the best thing they have on the menu...they are very generous on vegetables.   The spring roll, on the other hand, was way too chewy for me.  The floor was super dirty....
Average pho place. It's not comparable to the pho places in oc. Don't get their hu tieu. Pho is decent but egg rolls is overly fried.

Not what it used to be. Price is wrong. This place was known for their broth. Now the taste isn't there. Service was bad - party of 4 and got 1 napkin and asked 3 different servers for extra lime while they're just standing around avoiding eye contact with you. This place was great 6 years ago. Lost all they're great employees. Now it's just going down hill.

My friend says they have the best Pho in town! I had the #72 which is Beef & Broccoli over steamed rice. It was delicious! It's very thin beef and different than anything I've ever tried. The sauce was very thick but was delicious on the rice.

The egg rolls are my absolute favorite! I would go there again just for the egg rolls :)
