(-2) Our hostess was a rude. B.I.T.C.H. You do not wave customers off, bump into them and glare (Hello. You bumped first). As she was taking our orders, she was glaring when there was too much order. (Our pho order wasn't complicated so chill down lady. Lady you're working at a phone restaurant not Starbucks - THAT'S complicated). Service please.

One star is for that young guy with a tied back fohawk hairstyle. You saved our tummy and fixed our orders really fast. And I saw him make sure other tables got their orders too (Ahem. Those eggrolls...)

Anyways other than that, the reason why this place is popular because it's the one of the first pho you see along the way to hunger lane. So not worth the wait.

Loved this place. We were in LV for edc weekend and wanted to try some pho here. My friend recommended this place. We went there around noon. It was already busy.  We got seated quickly and the server took our order right away. We ordered the combination pho and shrimp spring rolls. 
The food was awesome. Not too salty but flavorful. The spring roll was fresh and tasty. Will definitely come back if we get back in LV again

Bo Nuong Vi is yummy.

Pho is just okay.

The last trip I had there wasn't as great. The spring rolls had some type of old taste to it. The "Com tam bi cha suong nuong" (rice, dry shredded pork, egg cake omelette, pork chop) was good except for some reason half of the pork chop was delicious but the other half was super dry - how did that happen?

This is a great fall back plan, but normally not my number 1 pick.

It's cheap. They give you a ton of meat. Those are the pros. The con? Really bland broth. Friendly and quick service at least.

Not a bad restaurant, but not great either. Pretty average pho spot.

My boyfriend and I ordered 80A and we made our own spring rolls. It came with a huge portion of marinated beef which probably could have fed another person easily. First time here but would definitely come back.

I like their Bun Bo Hue and their Nem Nuong. However, it's really smoky in there because they have BBQ but they don't have hoods. The beef was overcooked in their BBQ Beef Rice dish. Their Ca Gio is a little dry. I really like how it's so packed in there all the time. It's fun to eat at a hustling and bustling place. All the dishes come out so delicious looking. I enjoyed my experience overall.

the bun bo hue was really good! the broth was spicy and delicious! all i needed to add was lime and it was perfect! The meat was tender and oh so yummy in my tummy. i also tried the bun rieu which was not that great. it was very oily and there was so much tomatoes that that was all i tasted. the soy bean drink was very refreshing :) the price wasnt that bad at all.
Pho was mediocre at best. Prices were too high for what was being served. Fresh spring rolls were good! I wouldn't recommend this to anyone looking for that fire pho

I go here every time I go to Vegas and so do my friends.  It is filled with locals and Vietnamese having Pho at 9 in the morning!  We always get bar-b-q  with lettuce and we make wraps.  We really do not know what we are doing but the food is delicious and we often order sides and Pho.  I believe they take cash only (imagine that) for payment.  Go there and try it, I think you will like it very much!

I've been here twice on a recommendation of a local Uber driver (he knows where the good pho places are). He said that the broth here is better than the other restaurant we were planning to go to. I know I'm bad about writing a review from over a year ago but I recently went here again and the food was just as good!

Located in Chinatown, it's tucked away from the Las Vegas Strip. I got a rental car this time so I found the place pretty easily after a little GPS meltdown in Google Maps. I knew it was somewhere on Spring Mountain Road... Anyway, there's plenty of parking here in the lot and they are open pretty late. 

My usual order was the pho special combo with beef on the side. Never disappoints and it comes out super fast. Their broth is very tasty and I did not notice any MSG in it. All of the ingredients were fresh and delicious.

They take credit cards which is always a plus. Minimum is $15.
Very excellent, super fast service, and the Pho Bo Vien was absolutely delicious. The service is so nice and welcome and the prices are affordable.

I'm soo glad they are back in business! My family has been eating at Pho So 1 since we moved to Vegas over 10 years ago! we were so bummed that the closed for a few months during the holidays, we weren't sure if they were reopening.. but our family is happy they are back! We love the food! we never have any complaints when we go there! The new set up is nice! Definitely more up to date and modern! we've tried other Pho places, but this is still our favorite!

Their quality of food has gone done as I came here throughout the years for pho in Vegas. 

At my last recent visit, the broth was bland and the pho noodles were stuck together in clumps. The soup for it was plain and tasteless too. The bun bo hue's noodles were too hard and weren't boiled long enough and the customer service has gone down. The servers seem more clueless and lost. They often forget to refill our water when we asked and not remember to bring us whatever we asked. 

Not coming back.

Reason i'm giving this a 3 star is because of great customer service. We had servers constantly filling our waters and asking if we needed anything else. But the food was quite horrible in my opinion. My fried chicken was completely burnt and hard, it felt like it was cooked a few days ago and they refried it because it was very hard to chew. The soup was very very salty as well they have to cut the sodium for sure. I would never come to this place for the food again, but the service was amazing and plenty of parking.

This is the only place I go to for pho in Vegas. It's that phockin good! Their broth is clean, not too oily, and very tasty. I wanna say its the msg again lol, because msg makes everything tastier, right? It's like magic. And usually msg makes me really thirsty but not here. 

I also love their egg rolls (dipped in their fish sauce combined with sriracha and hoisin sauce ahhh), combination fried rice, and their beef and shrimp combination for bbq. By the way, does anyone know what that pink gel-like substance is underneath their grills that they bring out for bbq?
Always great here. Delicious vermicelli bowls and friendly service. I'm glad they are reopened!

the new pho so 1 changed the cook. majority of the food that i ordered are SALTY.. fried rice is salty, egg roll is also salty. the place looks great though. im just not coming back here again cos food is not great anymore. Sorry.
This is one of the better Pho joints among the many scattered on Spring Mountain Road. Super casual and decent service. Note: They take CASH ONLY.
I don't know if the owner changed but the service was horrible. We had to keep asking for our hot tea. It didn't come until we were half way done with our meal.

I'm really, really surprised that this place doesn't have 4+ stars and that it's hinging on a yellow status. WTF! I of course presumed Pho So 1 had a high ranking, and out of curiosity decided to check it out here on Yelp. 

You're talking about a place where all the Vietnamese locals/older generations go and eat. This has been an institution for at least 16 years (it expanded from one store front to two about 13 years ago, if I can remember correctly). My parents (born in what was once Saigon), friends and extended family all come here for Vietnamese food. Sure, they've tried Pho Saigon 8 (not bad) but this place is consistent in their tasty food.

The pho broth is always flavorful. I never feel cheated out of meat portions (balanced proportionately with the noodle serving) and they serve you a heaping side plateful of vegetables (I can't even stand those places that give you a little stem of thai basil to put in your soup). 

The sauces are solid. The goi cuon peanut sauce is delicious with great consistency, and the fresh shrimp spring rolls are always fresh. The fried egg rolls are meaty and just plain delicious -- they randomly were once too soggy a few years ago, but that's not the case anymore. The nuoc mam (fish sauce) is great, and that's not to be an overlooked thing because other places mess it up (along with the peanut sauce).

I also order their bun thit nuong. Their grilled meats are NOT fatty which is an unfortunate occurence in a lot of Vietnamese places and again, there is a decent amount of meat. 

Their Vietnamese iced coffee... I took it for granted how well they make it until I had it served to me in other restaurants. You think places can't mess up condensed milk with Cafe du Monde grounds and a little water, but shit, they do. My mom craved the coffee this morning and we went their this afternoon for lunch.

Their seven-course beef menu is reasonably priced (beats a good San Jose joint that specializes in 7-course beef). In fact, everything is. Anyway, the beef menu is really fun to order when you're introducing people to the world of Vietnamese food (just make sure they're not vegetarian). It's fun and definitely hands-on. You get to wrap up your slice of beef with a good handful of basil, mint, and vermicelli noodles and choose which one of the three sauces you feel like dipping it into. It's great fun in variety! If the fish sauce/nuoc mam and garlicy taste of things there didn't permeate my hands/mouth/face/body, it'd be a fun date menu. But don't take a date here for the seven-course beef if you plan on smooching later for the first time.... 

Ambiance: Okay, it's pretty much a typical Vietnamese joint. At least the tiles aren't slippery from grease like it was 15 years ago. It is clean and bright inside now. My dad doesn't really like the grilled smell when someone is grilling next to us -- but that's what you have to expect when at a Vietnamese place that does a good job with their grilling menu. But why am I even talking about ambience? It's not like it's a Thomas Keller restaurant.

Service: Okay, fine. So it can take a little while for a server to see you - BUT the food comes out REALLY QUICKLY so come ON, people! (I'm talking to those reviewers that complained a lot about it...not you.) So yeah, you wait a few extra minutes to grab their attention, but once they see you, they attend to you and from the time you order to the time you take your first bite, you've had time to prepare your chopsticks and sauces. This is also the case on a really busy Saturday afternoon. The owner's son that has worked there from forever ago remembers me from the time I was a little side-kick sister going in with her big brother. He just stopped by the table briefly to say hi, despite the restaurant being packed on a late Saturday afternoon. If something doesn't work out, they're flexible. I ordered the 7-course beef menu for a friend trying Vietnamese food for the first time, but he wasn't able to eat peanuts straight up. They took out the courses that had peanuts and switched it out with something else. I was AMAZED the waitress was even willing to stand there for more than five seconds on a busy night explaining what did or did not contain peanuts. 

I cannot tell you how often I crave this place while I've been living out in suburbia New York. I have to come to this place at least three times on a two week vacation while here in Vegas. And they are always consistent, so after all these years, I know exactly what I'm getting. I've tried other places that have popped up, but I still have no question about where I'd want to go.

Very solid Vietnamese food.  I enjoyed the iced coffee and rice vermicelli with grilled shrimp, egg rolls, and veggies.  This is the dish I get every time I go for Vietnamese.  My husband also enjoyed the pho ga (chicken pho soup).  Service is very prompt and generally friendly.

Ive been here 3 times in over 6 months. The first time the service was excellent, The food is always great but the service always pretty bad - mediocre, 

I ordered a bun cha gio thit nuong, it took a while before it came out. All of the people who were with me got their food and finish more than half their pho before I could even get my order. They never addressed my issue until I told them 15 minutes after the ordered. I had to hurry to finish my meal to leave, We were on a tight schedule. this place has good food, but crappy service. 

This place is good for those who dont mind the service but enjoy the food.

Excited to finally see that Pho So 1 is open again. The staff here is very friendly and really know how to treat their customers. In addition to the awesome guest experience, their food is top notch. I had the brisket pho and the broth was amazing. If you want the best pho and the nicest reataurant owners on Spring Mtn, you go here.

Service is quick and to the point, the place is full of smoke because they bbq in the restaurant need more vent.
Rare beef noodle soup is one of my favorite.

After a long crazy night at Vegas, I always crave for a bowl of pho the next day. I decided to check this place out since there were a lot of reviews on yelp! Parking was plenty since it was located in a large shopping center.  Another bonus is there was no wait. This place is good for small or large parties. The staff was attentive and served your drink right away. They came right afterwards to take your order and the food came out in a timely manner too.  The ave price for a bowl of pho is around $7. A little bit pricy since back at Sgv, you can get a bowl for $5-6. 

I ordered the meatball pho $6.95 while my bf ordered the pho tai (rare steak) $6.95. I have to admit, they will give you tons of meatballs. I felt like they served more meatballs than rice noodles. The meatballs were also good sizes. You would think I would have have a better review but what my bowl lacked was the temperature. I felt like my soup was lukewarm. I can handle hot soup, so this was just so disappointment. I come to have pho because of the hot soup... Not to have more meatballs and noodles. The soup did have flavorful but it just wasn't hot enough.  They did come out with a large plate of limes, bean sprouts, basils, and jalapeños. 

Would I come back, yeah I would. But I will pray my soup will be hot the next time around.

Their food is average, but their service is absolutely disgusting. Bun bo hue should have pork blood, but they were out. I asked for a discount and was told by the cashier that extra meat was added to make up for it. Obviously a complete lie. We also ordered a large bowl of pho, and we got what looked like the contents of a small bowl served in a large bowl. The pho tasted just average while the bun bo hue tasted awful. This place is open late so I thought I had found a go to late night spot, but I'd rather starve than eat here again. I'm avoiding at all costs, and I suggest you do the same. I think the biggest slap in the face was when the cashier told me they put extra meat to supplement the missing pork blood when she hadn't even left the counter the whole time I was in there, and the waitress didn't know my bowl was missing pork blood until she went into the kitchen to confirm with the cooks.

This place rocks my Pho socks.   
I am impressed by my late night pho search.   
Yummy
Yummy
In my
Tummy 
I will pho sure go back to this place

I had the #15 minus the brisket.  So that translates to pho with flank, tendon, and tripe.  To some people, that's all the nasties but to me it's all the yummies!

The bowl doesn't look that big but they really do pack in the noodles and fixings... so much that you can barely get any of the broth.  Speaking of the broth, it was lukewarm!  And that was for all three bowls of pho that we ordered.  That was disappointing.

Other than that, I still like how many choices you get on this menu.

One of the ways I pick a new restaurant to try is by looking at which one is bustling with people and has a full parking lot. This pho place, which I found on yelp first, fit the bill. I was impressed that the menu was in 4 languages! (English, Vietnamese, Chinese, and Korean) 

Got the pho dac biet xe lua (special combo) for 6.95 before tax.

Not very clean + rude service = formula for great Asian food. My rule of thumb is, the ruder the service and the dirtier the place is, the better the food, and that's what I rate. ;)

Came here for dinner and I got number 77 on the menu, which is the Com Ga Roti. The rice was a little mushy and the chicken was dry. The portion size was actually pretty big and I found myself surprisingly full after devouring it (I was really hungry). With they gave more veggies though. The service was good and the food came out fast. Overall, decent restaurant but I don't think I would come again since I'm sure there are better places out there.

Best pho place I know of. Being Asian I'm very particular with my Asian food. Especially with pho you have to perfect the broth because that's what makes it really good. 

We are from Utah and this is always our first stop every time we come to Vegas and we come here again before we leave Vegas. We always get pho and a side of grilled beef really good!

I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. Wait staff is not very attentive to customers. Probably overworked and underpaid yet restaurant will charge 15% extra charge for party of 6 and more. Brought hoisin sauce for ch giò?!? Ordered 6 dishes and they are all so so. Don't order nem nng for sure or ph.

As a Vegas loca(l) for about 13 years, this is the best pho place I've found in the 702. I've been to many before and many after my discovery of this place about 5 or 6 years ago. This place has me coming back because of their perfect broth, it's just right IMO and doesn't need to be masked with much hoison and sriracha because it's pretty darn good on it's own.

They never skimp on all the wonderful fresh herbs and veggies that accompany whatever dish you're having. I always feel bad not using it all up. 

But the biggest factor on my critiquing of vietnamese restaurants is the nuoc cham. Yep. Mhmm. That stinky, salty, tart, sweet fish sauce that I dip mostly everything into. Perfect flavor--almost as good as how my mama made it. Every other place is either too salty, or too watered down but this place got it just right. 

Another great thing about this place is that the food always comes out fast, even when it's busy. The service is really good, for this type of restaurant. I'll leave it at that.
Awesome Pho, Egg rolls & service'

Even busy but the rotation fast so we wit no more thn 5 min , soup so far is good to me , we always go to jenny pho but here the price is reasonable and the amount is enough , they to busy thats why they out of beef steak and pork , if someone complain about cockroach in the restroom , tell me where in vegas the restaurant doesnt have cockroach in the KITCHEN?!? I dont mean its fine with cockroach but why complain cockroach in the restroom ... It s not in ur food anyway , btw over all food is 4 stars to me but cause the service ... Even busy pace they try their best and we really appreciate... Sorry no picture i forgot lol ...

Came to get some pho and this place is closed for renovations and under new management. 

This is my go to place for pho!

Call me picky or predictable when it comes to my Pho, but I always stick to the basics.  An order of Pho and side of eggrolls. 

So this place was highly recommended to me by my dear, dear friend.  It wasn't difficult to find it especially when I'm not from Sin City.  Parking was plentiful.  Location is in a good size strip mall.  

As my family and I first walked in, we were just standing there, waiting patiently for someone to throw a glance at us, seat us, SOMETHING!   Ten minutes passed and all the workers were just busy serving everyone else.  Granted, they were moderately busy.  Anyway, as soon as the next customer came in they went straight to a table and sat themselves.  Soooo, we did the same.  Took another ten minutes to flag someone down to come to us and finally brought us the menus.  OMG, are you kidding me?! All I said to myself was, the frkn soup better be good or else my friend gets it! hahaha...

Thankfully, once we ordered, it wasn't too long before the food came out.  We ordered Pho, eggrolls, and the bbq pork.  Pho soup was good a 4/5.  Eggrolls were not so good 1/5, a bit too oily.  Bbq pork was really good 5/5, tender, juicy, and so bbq perfectly=)

Basically, its nothing to rave about.  

I don't think I will go back to this place whenever I'm in Vegas again.  The place does not look "clean".  And my mom used the restroom and she said it was filthy so I just had to hold mine until we checked into our hotel.

Honestly, I would only come if you can't find anywhere else to eat. The wait for seating was short but the wait for food was terrible. We got 3 meals out of 8 came out. We ended up leaving because we waited for over 40 mins and we still didn't get the rest out of the food. Not only that, when we asked numerous they kept saying 5 mins but when we got up and left, they were rude and told us that the rest of the food takes very long to make (they should have stated this before when we were ordering). I wouldn't have mind if I waiting if they told us beforehand but honestly 40 mins is unreasonable.

I was introduced to this place nearly a year ago by some co-workers. Outstanding! I have been several times and will continue to return. Although it has been a little while since I have visited Pho So, the waitress recognized me and asked if I wanted my usual, the steak salad with fresh veggies and rice. The steak is tender and juicy with just enough seasoning and spice. The egg rolls were fantastic as an appetizer. Definitely one of my better dining experiences. It's usually busy at lunch time, but it's never an issue with the attentive and efficient staff. The food is always served up fast and fresh.

Great restaurant. It was recently renovated and it looks very nice! Their Pho is very delicious! All ingredients are fresh and their service is very good. Parking may be a little tight since it's by a grocery store, but aside from that it's perfect!

I eat here a lot, my brother in law swears by the place, every time he comes to Las Vegas, this is pretty much his first stop.  

Pretty easily accessible on spring mountain, if you are going east towards I-15, might be a bit more difficult if you are going west and away from the I-15 during congestion.

I've heard that they use MSG, but I have no complaints about it, although I need to drink a bit of extra water.  My mom gets a headache sometimes after eating here, so she isn't a big fan of it.

You can order pho, rice or even get the grill to make your own rolls with the meat/shrimp they give you.  The food here is pretty good, probably some of the better Vietnamese food you would find here in Vegas.  Typically the meat is good, any of it (flank, steak, beef balls etc - or you can get the tendon or tripe if you like that as well).  I like getting the grill, reminds me of the old days of living with my parents and making that stuff at home and the nostalgic feel to it.

Orders are usually pretty quick - I tend to come here during non-rush hour times though.  Service is to be expected of a pho place because of its popularity.  Overall, quality place for the food, not so much for the service.

I think the broth need to be more flavor... the owner seems nice very jolly friendly there is a $15 minimum on a credit card but if you eat one bowl of pho and a Vietnamese coffee you just hit the line.

Pho So 1 has been our go to place for a quick soup, etc.  We used to frequent Shawnessey Vietnamese, but they were getting to be consistently poor in quality of their meals.  Pho So 1, is not your fancy diner, as most times you have to get your own water which is already poured at the front desk.  The soups are always consistently good, we've not had a bad meal there.

This place is reasonably priced for the amount they give you. I couldn't finish mine so had to take it to go.

I got the combination pho. It was good. The beef was tender and easy to eat. It had the right amount of flavors. The broth was good. 

The service was quick to take our order. And also the food arrived quick. They didn't come back after that lol. We didn't get more water except we got the bill.

The place closed down an hour and half earlier when I was there late at night. I don't know why but I saw them turn down people. It's not the cleanest place but it works. 

It's a good pho place to go to when youre looking for one at like 2 am.

**MEH VIETNAMESE CUISINE IN VEGAS**

Hangovers?

Vietnamese food to the rescue.

Did not order the pho, decided to go against the norm and ordered the BUN THIT TOM NUONG instead.

Fish sauce was MEH.

Noodles were MEH.

Greens were MEH.

Grilled pork and shrimp both MEH.

Egg rolls were not that impressive. Too thick with MEH fish sauce.

Menu were in Vietnamese, Korean, and Chinese. WTF.

Service was tolerable, not the best, but then again, to be expected.

Go to Pho Kim Long instead.

Wow this place looked like a dump but a really bustling and busy one. Came here for lunch on a Tuesday before my drive back to CA. It was packed! Only took maybe 10m to get a table. The tables are really close together and ours wasn't super clean. We also didn't have the utensil or condiment caddies. I had to eventually grab one from an empty table since our food had come out.

There were flies everywhere. So gross. One table asked to be relocated from their window table, because the flies were bothering them. There was even a dead fly on the utensil caddy at the table next to us. 

The only reason I give 3 instead of 2 stars is because the food tasted pretty good. Their egg rolls were fat and crispy, a stuffed with lots of pork, carrots, glass noodles and woodear mushrooms, and they were seasoned well. The chicken pho had shredded chicken breast and a ton of noodles. We even all requested fewer noodles and there was a ton of noodles. The broth had a good flavor, and you could taste the spices. Only complaint about both dishes was that they were both super greasy. The pho broth was so oily that none of us could really sip too much liquid.

My bro ordered the lemon soda (soda chanh), and they put so much sugar in it that it was undrinkable (even after they replaced the first one they brought out).

The food was good but the sanitation and cramped nature of the place are a major turnoff. Don't think I'll return. My stomach was doing somersaults for the first 30m of my drive. No bueno.

If you're looking for an authentic pho spot-- especially after a late night at the strip-- you need look no further than Pho So 1.

It's fairly spacious inside and does not boast the most impressive aesthetics. No, it's not exactly pretty inside but that shouldn't matter ultimately if all you crave is the grub.

We first tried this place after an eventful night at Encore and were all salivating for some hydrating asian cuisine. We couldn't have picked a better spot than this one.

I ordered the rare beef pho. It arrived eventually with all the delightful accoutrements I could have ever dreamed of having. Crunchy sprouts, flavorful leaves and stems, thin delicate beef that melts in your mouth. And of course, the broth itself. It was full and flavorful--easily the best pho I have ever tasted. Not too salty and not watered down-- I couldn't have asked for a better bowl of pho.

This continues to be a favorite spot for my friends and I whenever we are hanging out in the asian district.

Large portion, reasonable prices, food is flavorful and soup broth is on point! Love the new interior design as well! The employees are also very friendly and attentive! Definitely coming back with more friends and family!

Pho 1

Pho 1 was introduced to me by a friend, and what a delight. We ordered the Number 12  Tai Nam Gau. The broth was flavorful, and the "extras" to put in the soup were all fresh, and nothing wilted, which I have experienced at other establishments, thus making me question the food The egg rolls were phenomenal and flavorful The peanut sauce was outstanding.  Pho won my heart, however there were several ambiance issues that strained the dining experience.

While we ate, a kitchen assistant set up a work station next to our table, where he proceeded to refill bottles that are placed on the tables. It was distracting to hear the final sounds of various sauces being ejected from each plastic bottle. There were at least 20 that were refilled. When I thought it would be over, out came another set of bottles. I hope that if management reads this, prepping will be done in the kitchen. Another distraction was the lighting. The room could use a screen on the front window. The afternoon sun cast a light, and as I talked to my dining partner, she was like looking at a shadow. When I placed my glasses on, all she could see was the reflection of the overhead lights and we could only laugh that wearing glasses made one look like an alien. We began  a discussion on restaurants and ambiance. I realized even a food truck has it's ambiance  and if there was a jack hammer  performing roadwork next to the truck, it would ruin the experience.  We had our final laugh as a busboy began to clear tables and managed to stack dishes and toss in the silverware to create a cacophony of tableware sounds I realize these are minor issues, however it does make a difference  to improve the entire dining experience. 

I am not a fan of plastic bowls as the soup did not retain it's heat. The server never returned to offer a refill on out tea or offer dessert. 

 I will definitely return to Pho 1 as I enjoyed the soup,  however, if I was bringing a friend to enjoy  a meal and to talk, it would not be my number one choice due to the ambiance issues and the lack of service.

If I had to guess.... I've probably been to over 40+ Pho Restaurants in my life. I've been to Pho restaurants in San Jose, Little Saigon, all over LA and Houston and yet this is by far one of my favorite restaurants!! The taste is awesome (not too much MSG) and the restaurant itself is very clean and comfortable (for Pho restaurant standards).

Pho No. 1   deserves 4 and half stars.  This is the best Pho place in Las Vegas, and I grew up in the heart of Pho country.  Their Pho is probably better than 95% pho places in Little Saigon and the surrounding Southern California.

The broth is tasty, aromatic, delicious, full of beef flavor. The rice  noodles were cooked just right.  Their meats are sliced paper thin, taking away most of the texture and taste. I would give 5 star if their meats are sliced by hand thicker. The big bowl, really big, is about $9.  

Quite a few Mexicans ordered Pho. Their menudo is a close cousin.  Just have to make beef broth with bone, star anise, ginger and onion, may be a little cinnamon or whatever your heart desires.

Their appetizers samples, anything like spring rolls, shrimp rolls, pork rolls ect.. are $3 a sampling plate, which usually have 2 rolls in them.  The samples are delicious and a cheap and very good way to introduce clients to new dishes.  This place has some very tasty appetizers to drink with. 

The wait staff is efficient and friendly, including the young hostess who dresses and acts like a cool boy?

Pho N1 is my go to Viet food in LV from now on.

It was a rainy day today and the girlfriend and i decided it was perfect weather for some Pho! We always get rare steak and let me tell you t was delicious  the steak tasted well and there was plenty of it. The large is more than enough for the average person. Service was very attentive and location has gone thru a remodel and is looking very nice   if you love pho go check this place out!

im not sure what i can say about pho this place was okay, the service was like any other place just kinda okay the food was sub par to me ive had better pho broth before from other places in vegas so its okay the only thing i did love about this place was the portions. as i was ordering i noticed there are no sizes to pho so i was like dang this better fill me up. so after i got my pho i was eating it and i was starting my hangover haha yes i can feel the exact moment it begins. im strange so im sitting there x_x and prob a little drunk still since i couldnt even remember how we got to the hotel. my friends ordered egg rolls and that was a lot of food and prob a entree on its own haha and we didnt finish it. the best thing and different thing i love about this place is they let you order side things like meats etc. my friend had ordered grilled chicken on the side and it was really cheap and it was a lot of food thats what i love about asian places. lots of food for little amounts of money and full of flavor. we were sooo full.

this is the place i tend to eat at when im in vegas and want good vietnamese food.  Very friendly service and good food at a great price. This place has not ever let me down once. No crazy long lines and no wait. Every since person who works here is very friendly and they treat all their customers like they were regulars. I wish more establishments in vegas especially those big hotels hand friendly customer service just like this establishment.

Take your money and find another pho shop! I really wanted banh xeo and they say they don't have anymore, which was a lie because I saw another table getting it later!!! Idk why they would thy do that to customers!! I don't think I'll be returning back to this location!! Bad service!!!

Terrible service and it takes for ever for the food to come out. So why do we come back so often? THE SATAY IS AMAZING. The beef and beef ball satay pho is hands down my favourite and is the only reason we come back. In fact I can say we as a group have probably gone 30 times in the span of a year during our lunch breaks and still none of the staff recognizes us.

It's ok though cause the satay more than makes up for everything

This place is my must-stop everytime in I'm in Vegas for their Chè Ba Màu (a tri-color drink). I've had Chè Ba Màu at other Vietnamese restaurants and they were nothing comparable to this place. They use big red beans instead of the little ones or the mushy one. I love their pho, egg rolls (drool.. they make really good egg rolls, too) and their pork chop rice (yumm). 

Don't expect great service or a place to sit around with your friends and chat for hours. It's a get-in & get-out place to fill your stomach. 

I just wish they have one in Irvine. I'm craving pho and egg rolls as I'm writing this.

The 1st day in Vegas and this was the 1st place a local friend recommended. We were in the mood for some Pho, and this placed delivered. We started off with Thai Iced Teas and Fresh Spring Rolls. They were fresh with Shrimp and Mint leaves with a Peanut dipping sauce. I was also in the mood for some Pho, so I ordered a #16 Pho Soup with Meatballs. Everyone else got Pho with extra Tendons and Tripe soups. My Wifey raved about the Lemongrass Chicken with Rice. The Servers were very busy, but took care of us efficiently. Good place and Good food at reasonable prices. We will be back for more Pho when we are in the area again.

I am a big fan of Pho, and usually pho restaurants satisfy my pho cravings, but I just didn't feel it after eating at this place. The soup didn't taste right to me and the meal was a bit pricey for pho. 

I would give this place another shot next time I'm around Las Vegas.

I gave this place 3-stars because the service made up for the reasons stated. My soup cooled down after a bit so my meat on the side didn't cook, so the waiter gave me some more hot soup without me even asking. Now that's service!

Friday evening and I wanted 7 courses of beef, so I looked at their menu online just to be certain that they still offer it.  The menu still had it so hubby and I drove to China Town to eat this.  When we got to the restaurant, I looked at the special dish section and couldn't find the 7 courses of beef. I asked the waiter and he said they don't offer the 7 courses but they do have the combination protein meal.  

Since we were already there, we chose the shrimp, squid, and beef combination with the special vinegar hot pot.  A plate of beef, with several shrimp and squid was given to us, a burner with a pot of special vinegar and onions, a plate of rice paper, a plate of fresh veggies (well, most were fresh, there were wilted ones), and a bowl of steaming hot water.  This also came with two kinds of sauce, one made of shrimp paste and another with fish sauce.

Overall, the meal was ok.  Not something that I will return to Pho So 1 to have.  Service was good.

Have been coming here for many times whenever I visit Vegas. Don't know why I keep coming back, service is just so so, and  the pho is average at best. The brisket is very thinly cut and full of fat. The soup has minimal flavor. The only good thing is no wait and fast service.
Awesome find. Very tasty food and friendly staff. Broth was great and spring rolls and subs were om nom nom

Had the #71 (beef with rice) and O.M.G. It was good!! The meat was deliciously marinated and soft & juicy. 

Price wise, it is affordable and you can't beat it when the food is so yummy. 
 
The location is not in the best of areas. For the most part the inside was clean though I was more into my food than how it looked. I do hope they tend to their bathrooms a better.

Whether the weather is cold or hot, nothing can bring me to bliss than having hot hot tea and hot hot soup. This place just fills that void of my favorite things...hot tea & hot soup.

It may be a small, un-fancy restaurant but I can't stop not going to this place! This restaurant is always full of diners. It is well-lit at night and with windows to bring in day light. I always get a seating to a good table, although there may be a few seconds or minutes to wait. But immediately upon sitting and browsing at the Vietnamese menu, complete with Vietnamese language and figures, I would request hot tea first. Hot Hot Vietnamese tea (yes, it is very hot in a tall glass, so be careful..sip it first, don't drink from the glass fast) is served prior to my meals which I enjoy sipping with squeeze of juice from lemon...my senses goes in relax mode! A cordial smiling food staff would take my order in just the way I like it. I always order #35 which is "Hu Tieu Hau Vi" (Seafood with Rice or Clear Glass Noodle Soup with or without Soup) with a little addition that I like: chicken, clear glass noodles and with soup (see my photo). I always experience good, timely service. The soup is served hot!!, in a huge bowl complete with a heaping platter of green vegetables, lemon, bean sprouts, basil, mint & green peppers...i like that!, which I place on the soup as soon as it is served. I leave it there for a few minutes to "heat up".  In no time at all, this soup is "devoured"... I can get a little "greedy"-looking as I dig into the soup and have the greatest enjoyment of it. In between my meal, I usually get refills of the tea...wow, because I like their hot tea! The order of Tea is included in the meal that is ordered at no charge. It is so ample to know that at a reasonable price of $7.50 + tax it is a just rightfully sweet $10 altogether, whataaah meal! 

Other favorites of mine I like to order from time to time are:
#1 "Cha Gio" (Authentic Vietnamese Egg Rolls) which is wrapped in fresh rice wrapper = $5.25..I love biting into each with a brown dipping sauce,
#10 "Pho Dac Biet Xe Wa" (Special combination of well-done brisket, rare slices of steak, tripe & flank tendon with rice noodle soup) = $6.95...the portions of meat are cut large,
#21 "Pho Rau Thap Cam" (is Vegetables combination with Rice Noodles Soup) =$5.95...ordered on days I want my vegetarian fix,
#65 "Com Bi Cha Suon Nuong" (Shredded Pork Skin, Egg Loaf, Charboiled Pork Chop with Steamed Rice) = $6.95...one of my favorite rice entree,
#87 "Bi Nuong La Lot" (Beef wrapped in Hawaiian Lot Leaf) =$9.50..quite delicious,
#90 "Banh Xeo" (Pan-Fried Cake with Pork & Shrimp) = $7.95...awesome taste,
#8 "Ca Phe Phin Sua (Nong Hay Da)" is a french style hot or cold filtered coffee with condensed milk...this, i like sooo much, the blend of sweetness and bitterness is mouthwatering =$2.95,.
They also serve beer but "33" is the Vietnamese Beer you ought to try =$2.95.

The smell of barbecue in the air will fill your nostrils from other diners' choice of Special Dish called "Dac Biet". If you order this,it is to be cooked by you on the table, on a Griddle. This is is an array of meats or seafood on a platter as your choice from the menu listed as #80-#81 with a price ranging from$18.95 - $25.95. Especially a great choice for 2 or more dining companions.

This is my go-to place eventhough early morning hours, especially it is open Seven Days A Week from 9:00 a.m. to 3 a.m. 

Restaurant can also be found in Van Nuys, CA and Reseda, CA. 

Website is http://www.phoso1.net

I don't speak Vietnamese nor am I Vietnamese. My father (who's not Vietnamese either) lived and worked in Saigon & Danang,Vietnam because of his American employment there as a Civil Engineer when I was a child. I must have acquired the love for Vietnamese soup. 

But I learned from a food staff that "Pho So 1" translates to Beef Soup Number 1. To me, this restaurant is a #1.

i love their portion and the speed of service
sometimes, they are a little slow but overall
great food, and fast service

can't ask for too much at a asian restaurant though - you can't ask for them to smile when they are serving ^^

but hey, anyone who wants to try a pho, you should come here

Been coming here for almost 20 years! So yummy. it all tastes exactly like my family used to make. 
I've watched this business grow and grow! I feel like I grew up with the sons. :) 

I work on the strip and I've met people who always make it a point to come here when they are in town. I don't need to go into details, if you like Vietnamese cuisine, this is where you have to go.

I enjoyed my first Pho experience but what i fell head over heals for was the vermicelli bowls. I had the bowl with the grilled pork and eggrolls in it. it is full of flavors from the pork and eggrolls and the plentiful mix of veggies in the dish. The serve it with a side of fish sauce which i love to combine into the dish.

The service was impressive. When walking in we looked around for seats and someone came to sit us right away.

The first time I was here i was talking to the server asking about different dishes and he knew I was a newbee to PHO. He broght out one order and made two full bowls for me and my friend. Can't wait to go back!!

What a pleasant surprise! Good Pho in Vegas. Our group arrived around 10PM, and the place was packed. Our server promptly seated us, and then proceeded to take our order when he saw we were ready. 

I ordered a Pho Chin Nam, and the pho was ready within 5 minutes. The reason why I like Pho So 1 pho so much was that the broth was done right. It was not over MSGed like most pho places. The broth had a lot of flavor in it. In addition, Pho So 1 included plenty of meat. The beef was thinly sliced and was melt in your mouth delicious. The veggies were clean and fresh. Couldn't ask for more.

Pho So 1 makes one mighty fine bowl of pho. When visiting Vegas again, this will be our go to pho spot.

Stopped in on a weeknight, and this place was packed wall- to-wall....
According to lots of Yelpers, this is the spot for Pho, so of course I Get the Combination Pho, but I also gotta have a rice plate too, so I narrow it down to their roasted chicken plate or their grilled lemongrass chicken.

The waiter suggests the lemongrass chicken so I go with that. The wifey orders a Vermicelli bowl asking to substitute grilled chicken instead.

The Pho arrives first...Broth is clean and flavorful, noodles just right... overall, good dish. Lemongrass Chicken and Vermicelli Bowl arrive.
The Lemongrass Chicken obviously has been reheated and the vermicelli bowl has beef, instead of chicken.WTH????

One bite and I send the chicken plate back and ask to order something else...THE WAITER NEVER CAME BACK!

Wifey was hungry so she ate the beef in the vermicelli bowl...Just OK, nothing memorable. Pho KIm Long is still my go to spot with their combination Pho and Roasted Chicken with Seasoned Rice, a winning combination, IMO.....ALOHA!!!

Totally gross and staff is rude as hell. I just left this place and was annoyed by the fact that this place has 3.5 stars. Service sucked no one took our order for a good 20 min. Me and my boyfriend literally watched staff hold a convo and do nothing while we stared to get there attention. They never brought us water and everyone else had it on there tables. Never gave me a refill my boyfriend had to get up and ask them for one. Now to the food... The chicken in the chicken pho was way too big and tasted so dry and frozen I didn't even eat any of it. The broth was good but everything needs to taste good or what am I paying for? Just a bowl of noodles? Ordered 4 egg rolls that had a pool of grease beneath them. Put mine on a napkin and the napkin was drenched with so much grease when I picked the egg roll up that it saturated through to the table. So I didn't eat those either. They weren't worth the extra raise n cholesterol. Overall very shitty service and yuck food. No thanks!

pretty good, diverse menu, typical crowded chaos.  the asian spring mountain area has been growing over the years, and the asian food options keeps improving.  got the cha gio, nicely fried, pickled veggies not perfect.  the pho tai had good broth, decent noodle.  hu thieu also fine, but the com plate thit nuong was a little cold and not as good though correct flavor.

It is a shame to called this place Vietnamese food. Rice is not cooked properly, meat is too dried, Pho is too sweet. Dont expect authenticfood here. However, the customer service was friendly tho. I'd give a star for that.

I've been going here for literally YEARS it was considered to our family as a holy grail place to eat authentic Vietnamese Cuisine. It's has everything Vietnam has to offer all in a restaurant. The pho is flavored and seasoned really well and with fresh noodles and meat. They also give you a heaping side serving of fresh veggies to eat with pho. This place has a lot of good filling meals, that you won't be disappointed.

Am I missing something? I almost feel like the odd ball for not loving this place. Came here on a Sunday sometime around 11AM - 12PM and it was PACKED. It's been at least a good 5 months since I've had pho, last time being in Houston. So I got to share my first Vegas pho experience with Pho So 1. Seeing the crowd, I was sure I was at the right place. 

Well... not so much. We got sat within 15 minutes and you can immediately tell the waitress threw restaurant hospitality out the window and just wanted to quickly get our orders and out of here to turn the table over (...that's the expression right? sounds weird right now..). Anyway my parents ordered regular pho with everything you can think of in it and I ordered Bun Bo Hue. 

Both broths were extremely watered down with no flavor that could satisfy ANYONE's taste buds. Bun Bo Hue is typically supposed to be a tad bit reddish with the chili oil but mine looked murky brown. So sad because I was really craving some good Bun Bo Hue :'[

Hm, I'll have to give this place a second chance and go with something my fellow Yelpers ordered. In the meantime, anyone have any other good pho restaurant suggestions?

Oh my goodness, the delicious aroma of yummy food that awaits you as soon as you open the door to the restaurant is just incredible.  

Egg rolls were delicious and was served with fresh herbs and veggies. 
Charbroiled pork spring rolls- yummy! 
Bun bo hue was so good and so much too!

this place is on the opposite side of the of the I-15, away from the strip. it's located right next to a Big Lots and a Lucky's supermarket. in an area where all the other asian establishments are in LV. Vegas chinatown you could say.

we've tried a few other pho places in the area, but for some reason we keep coming back to this one. it's your run of the mill pho place, nothing special. pretty much the pho joint that you'd find anywhere else.

the one major minus of this place is the fact that the pho takes FOREVERS to come out. usually when you order a bowl of pho anywhere else. it comes out right away. for some strange reason, it takes soooooooooo long for it to come out here. 

I mean come on.. 

1)  broth? pre-made. 
2) noodles? pre-made.
3) meat? all ready and chopped up.

what the hell is taking so long?? throw it all in a bowl, pour the broth and serve while it's still hot! no need to make us wait 20+ minutes. i'm still slightly drunk and hung over. i want my damn bowl of pho! what the hell are you guys doing back there, gambling!? well... viet people do love to gamble, and it is vegas...

This place has always been my favorite pho place, but I stopped going because the restaurant was getting dirty & filthy. HOWEVER, after a few years, it looks like they've cleaned up the place & is in much better shape.

The food still tastes awesomely the same, the prices are good, and they give complimentary hot tea. 

The only negatives: it can get busy (to the point where you're sharing a table with strangers), and you end up leaving the place smelling like pho & BBQ! Lol

I'll definitely be back tho!

SCOREEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE!

Finally, real PHO. I'm so sick of Koreatown Pho in LA. 

Plus, I found out that there is a PHO SO 1 in Van Nuys, CA. I LOVE IT!


Two things to order:

1. Sizzlin beef. It comes with a burner, meat, lettuce wraps, vegetables 

2. Pho with rare beef. I love the price. $4.50? how can you beat that?

HANDS DOWN! ONE OF MY FAVORITES.

I really like this place.  Unlike other Vietnamese restaurants, which can have crappy service, the servers here actually come over to ask how everything is.  The food is always excellent and really cheap.  Even though it's further away than other Pho places, we make the drive.  So worth it.

Had lunch with a couple friends here since we were trying to avoid the long lines and expensive food on the strips. 
Pho was good but not GOOD...ha-ha!!
It is affordable and near the strip.
Got introduce here by my ex boss. Really nice place to have lunch or dinner. Food are great. I'd say A+ to their service. Will come here more often.
Yum! Love the bun no hue ! It's hard to find good bun no hue broth but they got it good here !

HATE  The trash on the floor.

DISLIKE  The waiter didn't come up to me for about 5 minutes until I flagged him down.  The setup (either rearrange tables to separate parties or force everyone to share tables).

LIKE  The broth in the pho. The mint leaves (I get really picky about how they look). The white meat chicken noodle soup.

LOVE  The meat and seafood combo with vegetables.

Good one restaurant that you have to deal, i came here a lot of time but just try only bbq steak, beef very nice and big order that i can share for three, next time i have to try other one should be nice too
For the BBQ you have to know how to wrap and eat because it's very special food

Came here for lunch per my friend's recommendation.  We ordered an assorted meat pho, a pick-your-own pho and vermicelli, a  rib eye pho.  The soup broth is very tasty with good portion sizes of pho and meat.  We liked the pick-your-own pho more than the assorted.  The rib eye pho was also tasty but the rib eye pieces would lump together if you didn't  separate them before the hot soup cooked them.  The pick-your-own vermicelli has lots of veggies and herbs (the non-herbs eater may find it a little too much), which gives it a unique taste.  Would definitely come back to try out other things on the menu.

My buddy & I wanted a quick meal after making the 4 hr drive to Vegas.  We wanted something in our tummy before checking into the hotel & going for a swim.  Apparently, summer has ended, but it sure didn't feel like it in Vegas this past weekend.
 
So I had the #62 Bun Rieu for $8.95.  It was okay.  I've had much better bun Rieu from Na Trang in the San Gabriel Valley of Ca. (Look it up, folks).  My buddy had the rotisserie chicken & rice.  He thought the chicken was a bit dry but he liked the flavored rice.

I love me some pho.  And this place is good!

A lot of people on here have complained about the service, but I've never had a problem.  Whenever my husband and I go, the guy at the register always acknowledges us and remembers us.  So much so, that one time the credit card machine wasn't working and he came over to us and said, "Just pay me the next time you guys come in.  You guys come here a lot!"  Who trusts people that much?  Someone who is confident in their food and customers.

The menu is huge, but I only ever get 3 things on there because they are so delicious, I never want to have anything else:

#5 - a grilled pork spring roll 
#10 - pho with every type of meat you can think of
#52 - a salad type of dish that has noodles, lettuce, grilled pork, and shrimp

I always say I am going to try one of the "grill it at your table" offerings, but that damn delicious soup keeps pulling me back!

Oh, and it also doesn't hurt that the prices are great.  Cheaper and tastier than other pho restaurants I've tried.  

Pho So 1 wins the pho wars in my book.

The taste is so weird 
Service is verry suck
Less food
Really hot
Really dirty
Badddddd
Never come back
This is an average pho place compared to the standards we have in Sacramento. Their broccoli and beef is the worst I've ever had. I've had the pho here on two occasions and was satisfied both times.

It was my first time and everything was pretty good here. We did the grill at your table set up with beef and strimp. We also ordered Pho, Egg Rolls, and #52. ( I don't remember what it's called) but it was delicious and probably my favorite thing that we tried. There was 4 of us that all shared and there was plenty left over to take home. All in all good place and would totally go back again! :)
This place has horrible customer service. There was a bug on my plate of veggies and they didn't seem to care or apologize. Will not be returning!
Not the best pho ever but darn better than most of them.  Service is pretty good too.  I definitely have this place bookmarked!

I found my favorite pho restaurant!!  Too bad it's 9 hours away in Vegas. =/

Never would I have thought to find pho in Vegas (& without a hangover) but the people that I roadtripped with were pretty Asian, lol.  We ventured to the Chinatown of Vegas that I never knew existed.  Based on Yelp reviews read on an iPhone, we chose Pho So 1, and boy am I glad we did.  Being early in the morning around 11am, we decided to share 2 large bowls of pho, 2 people per bowl.  It was plenty for each person and surprisingly one person had way too much meat than she could finish!  The meat seemed never ending which is definitely a plus in my book.  I usually order rare steak only, but this #12 included some brisket and other stuff.  To my surprise, I enjoyed all those (weird) parts of meat!

The utensils were very Japanese looking but new and clean relative to other Vietnamese restaurants.  Even their bathrooms weren't too shabby!

Later that night, after not eating dinner before the club scene, we decided to come back at 2AM. Lucky for us they are open 5am-3am!  Awesomeness.

This place was open at 1 am. That helps since a lot of other places close down. The menu is pretty standard but there are a lot of items to list and sometimes the server is standing in your back pocket waiting on you to make a choice. I literally was handed a menu, she went and got me a glass of water from 10 feet away and then looked at me, waiting.. Feeling the pressure I wilted and ordered the Pho special.  But just as fast, she was sneaking up behind me dropping of my meal. It was warm, pretty tasty, and very filling.  I enjoyed it and would come again, although I might run away from the waitress so I can have more time to scan the full menu.  

I'll be back although I have to try the other Pho around the Mountain.

Good food we plan to come back. The avocado shake was really good, not too sweet. The young coconut drink also very good.  I had the spicy beef pho #15 and enjoyed it very much. The salad rolls were also very good.
Love this place! Their pho is so good and very good service. Problem is that it's always busy so sometimes it can get very crowded but their food is very good.

My family is kinda crazy. We have 12 people everyone ordered and one of my aunts ordered and left to go look at the stores around the area. My other aunt had changed her order because she thought that is what she wanted. After coming back and finding out that she was missing a part of her meal, she was upset and yelling at her sister about how she changed her order. The restaurant was so nice to give us a steak for free. We didn't ask for it, but they are great  people. I'm not going to lie the water here taste gross. Not like water. The tea was tasted like hit water.  Other than that it was great.
Incredibly cheap, about $7 for very generous portions. Taste was good.

Wow. Can't tell you how disappointed to have to write this negative review.
I have been coming to this restaurant for 7 years, and always considered it to be my favorite spot- until recently.

I'm not sure if the ownership changed or what, but things are definitely different at Pho So 1. They have forgotten about my order twice in a row, the food is cold, servers seem like they don't care. Texting and laughing on their phones by the counter. Higher up management also seems apathetic and doesn't care when customers are ignored.

Killed my favorite restaurant :(

I arrived with my family of 6. We were seated, there was one menu on the table, no one brought us more menus. Turns out we never needed the menus because we continued to sit for 20 minutes, no one ever acknowledged us, except the gentleman who brought us water, 13 minutes in after feeling our stares for some kind of service. He failed to even say one word or make any kind of eye contact to offer help, he just dropped off the waters and took off. We couldn't wait any longer so we left. As our family of 6 stood up, a couple of the employees just watched us walk out, a lost customer for life.
This place serves a lot of meat and the service is not bad at all. The soup is soooooooooo delicious like the real authentic pho taste

This is probably one of the better places to go for Pho.  I'll always come here after a night of drinking unless it's too crowded in which I'll go somewhere else.  The egg rolls and spring rolls here are one of my favorite.  The rice plates (com bi cha) dishes are also good.  Sometimes the waiters can get confused, but not often.
i went to there yesterday night.  they closed for renovation. .some one know when they will reopen again  ?

Recommended by local poker players as the best pho in vegas. 
They were not bluffing. 

Huge portions and fresh pho feeeeeeexins. The BunBoHue was amazing. Savoury broth with appropriate meat to noodle ratio. Absolutely worth the trek off strip. 

#1 Vegas hangover cure. 

If only hotel room service was available......

Great place. I was wondering why they closed, but looks like they are open again, which is good!

I had the classic bun bo hue, which is great for a runny nose. It was very tasty, and the broth was flavourful. 

The service was nice. Waters were refilled often!

POLICE POLICE POLICE POLICE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Everyone, please read my review before coming here.  This place is seriously horrible.  I have actually been a regular here and been ordering the same thing everytime i enter this restaurant.  I literally know how much quantity the dish that i order normally comes out until i have recently visited here. 
Our waitress comes to us to take our order and i asked her a few questions on her menu and she literally says " ihave no idea".  I asked are you new here, because i found it odd to not know anything on there menu.   I ordered the beef marinated griddled on your table dish which comes with a side of vegetables.  The vegetables came out not even a half portion of what it should usually come out and complained about it, and found out later that the waitress was the owner.  Isnt that funny?  she has no idea what is in and whats on the menu.  HORRIBLE!
She was the most rude person i have ever met in my life.  Because of her rudeness and not wanting to give us what we pay for and wanted, i did not want to pay for what i had not eaten, i had told her i will pay for what i ate but this is ridiculous because i havent even ate half of what i ordered, and she brings a box and says take it to go.  I immediately got angry and said no, and she called the POLICE! hahahhaa.  The officer was a great respectful man and told me to just pay for it and report this restaurant to the Health department/news to get the on t.v to show them how bad they are and he gave me an event number for the case.  I only give them a 2 star because all there servers are really nice, a bit slow but at least respectful, except the lady owner.  She was straight up rude and needs to be taught a lesson.  By the way the restaurant is so DIRTY.  I really hope they lose some customers and get caught on TV.
I'm not gonna give a star this restaurant..the service so bad and they barely understand English and they rude...red flag...red flag....

Located in Chinatown. The sign is pretty big, you won't miss it.

I ordered the CHARBROILED PORK, SHREDDED PORK SKIN AND EGG LOAF WITH BROKEN RICE. There were a few pork slices that were all fat, but besides that, the pork was tasty. The shredded pork skin and egg loaf were also really good. The best friend ordered the BUN BO HUE and she really enjoyed it. If you want to try the VIETNAMESE COFFEE WITH CONDENSED MILK, it's very sweet so be warned. 

It's a solid pho place. Food came out fast, service was good, nothing to complain!

It's alright. Nothing good or bad. 

Mediocre service, the inside of the resteraunt was chilly :(! Normally I prefer room temperature places to eat pho at, especially since the evening was really chilly. 

As for the pho, I ordered pho with rare steak: the portion was small, and there is one size only (I think). 

Soup was warm, but not too hot, and noodles were a bit too thin. Restrooms were messy and full of TP on the floor :(

I remember coming here maybe 2 years ago, after a vegas trip in which I was terribly drunkover (drunk + hungover) and some friends and I ended up here. I didn't have an appetite, but I ordered pho and I just drank the broth. AND THE BROTH WAS THE BESST I've ever had! I drank the entire bowl of broth and was satisfied.

Fast forward 2 years, present day. I was randomly reunited with this place after another vegas trip. Got the noodle bowl with shrimp and pork..ahh perfect seasoning & flavor. Lots of lettuce and noodles. yum.

Ok, maybe my review is bias because I'm from west LA and there's NO vietnamese restaurants..that are good, anyway. But I freakin love this place :)

One of the original Viet restaurants in town I haven't been in a while. Place has been remodeled - new, nice and clean!!! Had Bun Rieu and Crispy Rice Noodles, my favs  Food was as good as I remembered and service was on point. They have drinks with crystal bobas and it's sooo good! Not your typical chewy bubbles, but a pleasant pop of surprise.
Good food good service . I live 15 min away , In less than an hour I went, got stuffed, and made it back to my bed.
Soups and Gai Chao is good... ambience is not that great... they need tidy up a lot...

Never judge Pho by it's cover....

If you eat Pho, you know the tables are gonna be dirty, the service poor, floors not swept..... but that's the norm.  Minus all that and get down to the Pho itself.  This place is the best so far in Vegas.... better than the "best in vegas" Pho Saigon 8 (they paid off the reviewers, if you ask me)

I had the #10 Pho dac biet (special).  Broth is good n tasty, doesn't seem to be any MSG?  The best meat is the Tai (rare steak) be sure to eat this first....as it is very tender than most other places.... veggie tray had like 9 slices of Jalepenos!  Gotta have my Jalap-penos...tea is served in a glass tumbler HK style but I burned my fingers trying to drink it (should be plastic) 

The menu is more extensive than just a Pho place.... rice plates, bun, bo 7 mon....(beef seven ways)  saw lots of peeps having that.....must be gooood here.  

Topped it all off with a soda chanh to go, sweet n tart and very limey....refreshing.

til next time, good Pho-ing?  Is that a verb?
Great food. Great service. Hands down the best Pho in Las Vegas. Definitely check this place out you won't be sorry.

Wow this place sure has gone downhill in the worst possible way.  God how I miss the Pho Sol 1 old school days from years ago. This has now become one of the worst Vietnamese restaurants in all of Las Vegas. 

Sure they remodeled and everything looks a bit more modernized but upon sitting down and looking at their new menu, It was immediately disheartening to see not only did they jack their prices up, they decided to go the Ala Carte route with some of the Vietnamese dishes which is so ridiculous especially with rice dishes that used to cost $9.95 are now up to $14.95. 

Our waiter told us they fired all the old staff/cooks/servers and are starting on a fresh new leaf. If this is what they call a fresh start count me out, especially when there are such good and reasonably priced Vietnamese restaurants literally around the corner like Pho 90 and Kim Long. 

The portion was so small for my rice entree dish & meat was full of fat, yet the prices were inflated to the max for mediocre food. Total highway robbery at the Pho Sol 1. Never again!!!

This is one of the best Vietnamese restaurant in Vegas. The regular beef pho is on average but the beef stew pho in tomato carrot soup is exceptionally good. We also love the bbq pork on broken rice. It is almost as good as the ones we have in LA. The locals visit this place too so it gets crowded often. It is a cheap and clean restaurant we go to whenever we feel sick of the buffets.
Service was fairly quick & the food tasted decent.  I had the Pho Tai and I thought it was nothing special.  Compared to pho back home in Little Saigon, I would prefer that more.

Whenever my family and I come here, we usually order Bo Nuong Vi(grilled meat).  It comes with the plate of meat and/or seafood and banh trang(rice paper) and rau(salad and veggies).  You get to grill the meat and wrap up the spring rolls yourself.  One order usually fills up 3 of us while my dad usually gets Bun Bo Xao(lemongrass beef and noodle).  Total for the Bo Nuong Vi and Bun Bo Xao comes out to about $40 for 4 of us. The service is alright, the Vietnamese people aren't that friendly, but that's typical in Vietnamese restaurants.

hands down the best pho ive ever had here in vegas!!!! place is amazing n cheap too!! there eggrolls are BOMB as well as there springrolls my fave is Num 56...if you love vietnamese food then surely stop by and get a plate of pho!!

My family's go-to for Vietnamese food. The pho is delicious, piping hot, and all at a great price. I love getting their bo luc lac is my favorite, soft and flavorful. 

We've gone here everytime we go to vegas, at least once a year ever since I was little. Bring your family in to try!

I'm giving this a 4 star only becuase it has 5 star PHO, but 3 star environment. service is shotty, they are so busy they dont keep it as clean as they should. I have had PHO 20+  places in LV, and this is the best. Friends I have brought have liked different items as well.

Worse food ever!!  My family went here for lunch for the first time and it will be the last time.  We had never tasted anything like before.  We got the com, pho, bun thit nuong, che, and it tasted really bad.

Where do you go when you want pho for breakfast, lunch, and dinner? 

Day 2 of our family LV trip and my grandpa wanted so vegetables to wash down his colon. So on a cold night, what is better than a hot bowl of noodles (okay, I know what the counter answer is, but we're talking about eats and there might be children reading this).

I got the goodness of beef flank and tendon pho for around $6. Damn good deal especially since you can get this from 9am to 3am! :)

The place was super busy, but even as busy as it was I was seated quickly.  Service thorughout my dining experience was good for a busy Vietnamese restaurant.  I mean I have been a dead, quiet Vietnamese restaurants and received worse service.

Unfortuantely, the food was not as memorable.  The pho didn't really stand out in anyway.  The condiments were the standard bean sprout, thai basil and citrus.  They give you lemons instead of limes.

I also ordered the pork meat ball spring rolls,  They weren't really pork meat balls, more like pork meat logs cut into planks.  The meat planks weren't that flavorful and because they were logs, grilled and then cut into planks, there wasn't that surface area to get that good charred, smokey flavor.  The sauce that came with the spring rolls was also very watery and didn't compliment the spring rolls well.  

The food is not spectacular, but the service is pretty darn good.

The first time we went to this place we found that the food was amazing, but the service was absolutely terrible.
Me and my friend decided to return to this place because we were starving and craving their amazing pho. When we arrived I went straight to the restroom to wash my hands. I look down at the floor of the restroom and what do I see? A cute little baby ROACH!!! Yes, a roach! Where's its mother I wonder? Probably with daddy roach reproducing more and more brothers and sisters so that baby roach won't be alone. Or maybe they are in the kitchen feasting on the delicious pho (hey, I don't blame them). Yes, it was just a little roach and yes it did freak me out, and yes we all know that when there's one theres probably many... However, when I got back to the table my fatass ordered some pho and eggrolls. I guess I wasn't too scarred! I refused to let the baby get in the way of my dining experience. I'm just glad the pho was delicious!!!!! Might have been the best and worst decision of my life 
Pho= 5 stars
My friend in the restroom=0

I have been coming here since I was a little girl thanks to my half Vietnamese half Mexican cousin. She introduced us to this place as one of her favorite spots in Vegas.

That being said I've been here at least 30 times with friends and family and I'm always so satisfied. 

The pho is flavorful in itself, although it's true that there are times that it isn't served piping hot. Most of the time it does come out pretty hot, but when it doesn't it still is hot enough to cook my raw beef shank that I get in my number 11, which is hot enough in my opinion. I personally like to add some lime juice and a little soy sauce cus I'm a salty eater. I also tend to get an order of eggrolls to share with the boyfriend. Always taste so good, can't resist ordering some every time we go there. 

We also like to get the #89, the diced beef salad. That beef is to die for, and half the time I can't decide between a bowl of delicious pho or some of that delicious beef salad. My boyfriend likes to get it as a smaller portion with tomatoe rice when I'm more focused on my pho.

We've tried a few different things here and they all taste pretty good, but the #11 & #89 are our favorites with an order of eggrolls. Thai tea is also great here. 

I've gone to several pho places all over Vegas and most of them are more expensive for a less flavorful broth. Pho So 1 just feels like home. 

Unfortunately they've raised prices recently and sometimes forget to wash the lettuce that comes with the egg rolls. We always get seated right away but service is not the best. They're straight to the point, not really bad but not necessarily good. That's why I only give them a 4/5 even though I love this place so much haha.

Service was all right, the food was pretty good, but the bathrooms didn't look clean at all. I usually check the bathroom to determine the cleanliness of a place and the bathroom was disgusting. The smell of the last occupant lingered for a good 5 minutes and I still felt dirty even after I washed my hands.

Anyway, the food was pretty good. I'm not really a Pho connoisseur so I got the basic pho with beef balls. The server we had was all right. He didn't ask if I wanted a refill on my drink which bothered me because he refilled everyone else's but mine.

Hmm... There's not much to say about this place except that the pho was "so so." the price was average. The service was very minimal, they only came by to take our order, deliver our food and send us the bill. Even when we asked for help, the bus boy gave us a look and said "I'm not your server, I will get someone." Yet, no one came. I wouldn't recommend this place or discourage it... :/

Got the Bun Bo Hue and an iced coffee here.  Had to stay this is a pretty vanilla pho house.  There's nothing about this place that stands out.  The service is decent, the pho comes out hot, and the prices are reasonable.  The biggest thing i noticed was how small the X-Large bowl of pho was.  I thought it was going to be beastly in size, but unfortunately, it was pretty manageable.  If you're staying on the strip and you want pho, i would recommend trying this place.  It's across the street from Hot N Juicy Crawfish which was featured on Man vs. Food.

Came here after striking out on 2 other Pho places during EDC weekend. 

This place was sizable and pretty easily fit our group of 12. It was close to the strip, about a 10 minute drive so we got in an out pretty quick. The parking is plentiful here unlike a lot of other nearby-the-strip pho places.

The service is what you'd expect at a popular pho restaurant. The workers are all running around trying to take orders, fill drinks, and deliver the food. It takes some effort to flag one down but it's fine, I'm here for the food. 

I got the regular beef pho and I it was fantastic! The broth was beefy and light. The noodles were chewy and plentiful. The meat itself was tender and juicy too! If i had to say, I'd say it was very comparable to Garden Grove pho.


If you're looking for pho near the Strip, definiately try this place!

My cousins went here a couple weekends prior and said this place sucked. I shoulda figured it'd just gone downhill in the last year. Or maybe I shoulda checked my previous review first. My dumb ass ordered the bun bo hue. Shoulda gone with the fried pho. Maybe that's still good..

Was in Vegas for only 2 days and was recommended from a Vietnamese friend to come here since we were in the mood for some delicious soupy noodles.  It was like 2AM and luckily this little gem was still open.  Simply put, this will be a must stop for me every time I will be going to Vegas.  

The soup in the Pho is a perfect balance of non overwhelming flavor, freshness, and authenticity.  Servers are very charismatic and prices are very fair.  Only con I can name is the place is a bit dirty feeling, otherwise an amazing meal!

I'm not sure why my parents swears that this place is the best pho place in Vegas...but sure. We always go here to grab pho when we're in town because they like it here. The broth is cleaner than most places that I've had...but it is also bland. I've tried their pho, shaken beef, and broken rice dishes... They all lack a lot of flavor.

A pro about this place is that they give you a lot of meat with their dishes! I just wish they had more flavor..but more meat is never bad.

The soda chanh (lime and soda water) is terribly mixed. Usually one would mix it with hot water first so the sugar dissolves but I don't think they do that at all. In order for me to taste the sweetness, I constantly have to stir the drink and drink really quick from the bottom before the sugar all settles again.

I want to say that I don't want to come back here again but my parents still enjoy it here. Maybe up until I find a better location...

The food was delicious and my kids loved it. I did not love the service, though.  The waitress was weird & rude. When she took my order she didn't even look at me... She just walked by, wrote what we wanted, and left with a face of ignorance.

The pho here is awesome, there is a line out the door all day long.  Here is why I just give it an OK: they only take cash and you will get MSG Coma instantly.  I can't tell you how many times I fall asleep and feel drowsy after eating at this place!  It NEVER fails, everytime I eat here, it's like someone put a roofie in my pho and when you wake up, you drink a gallon of water.
We always order takeout: #15 with extra noodles and the crispy egg rolls. We have never been disappointed....highly recommend.

This has been my go to spot in Vegas for Pho.  After a long day and night of drinking, this place always hits the spot.  Hot noodle soup with a lot of lime and chili to wash down the alcohol after taste.  

Dac Biet or the Number 1 is what I always get.  It's simple and it has everything.  Egg rolls to start and I am set.  Then when i'm up for it I will add a cup of Ice coffee as well.

We literally went from airport to Pho So1, the parents came in from SF and I knew they would be hungry.  My man is on a "eating healthy" kick so he knew my old Asian parents would be just fine with going there.  My dad and I were doing the Tom/Bo Nuong Vi ( shrimp/beef we grill at table and roll ourselves), my man had pho tai ( rare beef pho) and the kids all had pho with no meat.

My mom (being vietnamese/chinese) was SO picky cause you know how old school asian moms are- nothing is as good as theirs. So she finally settled on the banh xeo (crepe like thing with shrimp, bean sprouts, fried and served with herbs and nuoc mam).  I think she complained the whole time that it was a little hard- not as soft as how she's had it in SF...okay mom, but you finished the dish...so it wasn't that bad?

My dad and I thoroughly enjoyed our dish- with the shrimp paste dipping sauce.  I think that's the best part of the dish!!  Yes, yes, I am SO asian cause that dip makes you stink SO bad, but is oh SO good!  Anyhow, they bring out all the condiments to our dish- lettuce, assortment of herbs, rice paper and vermicelli noodles.  We grill up all the shrimp and beef and roll away...YUM! Word of advice, don't cook the beef too long or it becomes really tough..

We also ordered a beef carpaccio dish (Bo Tai Chanh) that was really good, the beef was so tender. 

The place wasn't too busy when we arrived at 7:30pm but next thing you know, it filled up.  It seemed like a lot of people ordered the shrimp/beef dish that we had, but how can you not when first thing you see is people grilling meat at the table when you walk in?

Overall it was a good night.  Service was decent, better then most Vietnamese places, all you had to do was wave to someone at the counter and they were right over.
Oh- and unlike some places on Spring Mountain, they DO take credit cards...I mean honestly I never have cash on me and its always a pain to stop and get cash...
